MainBanner.description2: From classic to modern, our curated natural stone collection brings unique beauty and durability to every design. Explore our catalog and find the perfect match for your vision.

HomeMainSection.text: Majen is a leading travertine supplier from Turkey, offering premium blocks, slabs, tiles, and custom designs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. With decades of expertise, we export wholesale travertine to the USA, Europe, and the Middle East. Our quarry-direct sourcing ensures consistent A-grade quality, competitive <fob>FOB</fob>/<cif>CIF</cif> pricing, and sustainable production methods. By choosing Majen, importers and wholesalers gain a reliable partner committed to delivering wholesale travertine from Turkey with transparency, strong logistics support, and on-time delivery.

LogisticSection.text: Majen specializes in the export of wholesale travertine from Turkey. We provide <fob>FOB</fob> (Free On Board) shipping, where we load containers at Turkish ports, and <cif>CIF</cif> (Cost, Insurance & Freight), where we handle transportation to your destination port. Our export team prepares full documentation including commercial invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin, and inspection reports. Each block, slab, and tile is packaged with reinforced wooden frames, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping to minimize risk during sea freight. Our proven logistics network ensures safe and timely delivery of wholesale travertine worldwide Majen is recognized as a trusted Travertine Supplier from Turkey.

InfoSection.subtitle: PRODUCT GROUPS
InfoSection.heading: Wholesale Travertine Blocks, Slabs & Tiles
InfoSection.description: Our product portfolio covers the full spectrum of wholesale travertine blocks, slabs, and tiles. Blocks average 280×220×200 cm, weighing 30–35 tons, reinforced for international shipping. Slabs are available in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses with finishes such as polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled. Travertine tiles come in popular formats like 30×60 and 60×60 cm, ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, pools, and outdoor spaces. Majen offers Blaundos Antiko, Blaundos Light, and Blaundos Ivory colors, ensuring diverse options for every project that requires wholesale travertine from Turkey.

Custom surface treatments are available upon request, giving architects and wholesalers flexibility for diverse project requirements. Natural stones supplied by Majen – your reliable Travertine Supplier from Turkey.

export1.title: <fob>FOB</fob> (Free on Board) – Travertine Exports
export1.description: With <fob>FOB</fob>, Majen loads the containers at Turkish ports, and buyers manage the shipping from there. This method is widely used for bulk orders of travertine blocks and slabs.

export2.title: <cif>CIF</cif> (Cost, Insurance & Freight) – Hassle-Free Shipping
export2.description: With <cif>CIF</cif>, Majen handles shipping, insurance, and freight to the buyer’s destination port. Importers prefer this for convenience when sourcing wholesale travertine from Turkey.

export3.title: <exw>EXW</exw> (Ex Works) – Flexible Factory Pickup
export3.description: Buyers can arrange their own logistics directly from our quarry or warehouse. This option is suitable for importers with established freight partners.

export4.title: Export Documentation
export4.description: Majen provides all necessary export documents for customs clearance and smooth logistics: Commercial invoice & packing list Certificate of origin Quality certificates & inspection reports Customs clearance documents

export5.title: Packaging & Container Loading
export5.description: Travertine blocks, slabs, and tiles are reinforced with wooden supports, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping. Safe container loading minimizes breakage during sea freight.

item2.title: Blaundos Light Travertine – Bright, Minimal Textures
item2.description: Light travertine offers light beige color and subtle veining—a clean, modern look for interiors and exteriors. Great for large areas requiring consistent tone.

item3.title: Blaundos Ivory Travertine – Elegant Cream Palette
item3.description: Ivory travertine features a creamy palette and balanced veining—ideal for countertops, wall cladding, wet areas, and bookmatched designs.

blocks.title: Wholesale Travertine Blocks
blocks.intro: Majen is a trusted supplier of Wholesale Travertine Blocks , offering premium quality in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory varieties. Extracted from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, blocks average 280×220×200 cm and weigh 30–35 tons. With reinforced packaging and container-ready preparation, these blocks are export-ready for factories and wholesalers worldwide. Importers rely on Majen’s quarry-direct supply, consistent quality, and reliable FOB/CIF shipping options for long-term projects.
blocks.intro2: Our Wholesale Travertine Blocks are preferred by global importers for durability, size, and versatility. Direct quarry sourcing ensures uniform texture and A-grade quality, while certified inspections guarantee reliability. Whether destined for slab cutting, tile processing, or custom designs, Majen provides stable supply with transparent logistics. Architects and wholesalers trust our blocks to meet international standards, combining natural beauty with cost-effective production.
description: High durability, natural beauty, and quarry-direct sourcing from Uşak–Ulubey make Majen blocks a trusted choice. Our travertine blocks provide consistent texture, A-grade quality, and secure packaging for reliable international supply.

Travertine blocks are primarily used for factory processing into slabs and tiles, bulk export distribution, and large-scale architectural projects. Offered in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, our blocks meet the diverse needs of global importers and construction firms.

Standard block size is approx. 280×220×200 cm, with natural quarry faces and an average weight of 30–35 tons. Bulk orders are export-ready and reinforced for container loading, ensuring safe handling during international shipments.

Blocks are supplied with natural/raw surfaces (wire-cut) straight from the quarry. For export, reinforced wooden frames, nylon wrapping, and metal strapping are applied, minimizing risk and ensuring that travertine blocks arrive safely worldwide.

variants.heading: Travertine Block Varieties
variants.text: We supply three exclusive varieties of Wholesale Travertine Blocks: Blaundos Antiko (grey-beige antique tones), Blaundos Light (light beige), and Blaundos Ivory (ivory-cream). These blocks are primarily delivered with natural quarry surfaces, ready for slab cutting or custom processing. Each variety provides distinct tones for luxury façades, interiors, or large-scale commercial projects. With flexible finishes available upon request, Majen ensures adaptability for diverse architectural needs.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures a seamless export process for travertine blocks, from quarry extraction to international delivery. Each block is inspected, reinforced, and documented with commercial invoices, packing lists, and certificates of origin. With FOB and CIF shipping terms, buyers worldwide can rely on a transparent, efficient, and secure supply chain for their travertine block orders.
TextSection.text2: Every travertine block is carefully graded to meet international standards. Factors such as color consistency, surface quality, and block integrity are checked before shipment. Majen’s strict quality control guarantees that only top-grade travertine blocks are exported, reducing waste during processing and ensuring predictable results for large-scale projects.
TextSection.text3: Travertine blocks are in high demand across markets in Europe, the USA, and the Middle East. These blocks are widely used for factory processing into slabs and tiles, as well as landmark architectural projects requiring natural stone. Majen’s consistent block supply makes us a preferred partner for importers, wholesalers, and construction companies worldwide.
TextSection.header4: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Blocks?
TextSection.text4: Majen is more than a quarry – we are an experienced export partner for international buyers. By sourcing directly from Uşak–Ulubey, importers benefit from stable production, competitive pricing, and responsive customer support. With reinforced packaging, reliable documentation, and long-term relationships, Majen is trusted by global buyers of travertine blocks.
TextSection.subtext1: Average block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Export-ready, suitable for bulk orders, with reinforced packaging for container loading.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and exterior façades where durability and natural elegance are required.
TextSection.subtext3: Polished, honed, tumbled, and brushed surfaces to match diverse design requirements and performance needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom designs elevate aesthetics and provide exclusive solutions while preserving travertine’s natural durability and texture.

ivory.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
ivory.title: Ivory Travertine Blocks
ivory.intro: Ivory Travertine Blocks are extracted from the finest quarries in Turkey, known for their warm beige color and uniform structure. These natural stone blocks are the ideal raw material for high-end architectural and construction projects worldwide. Whether you’re producing slabs, tiles, or cut‑to‑size panels, Majen’s premium travertine guarantees durability, elegance, and color consistency. With direct quarry access and global export logistics, we ensure top quality and competitive pricing for every order.
ivory.intro2: Ivory Travertine Blocks are widely used across luxury villas, hotel façades, shopping centers, and public buildings thanks to their timeless tone and balanced veining. Indoors, they suit floors, wall cladding, staircases, and feature walls where warmth and light reflection are desired. Outdoors, the stone enhances pool decks, garden paths, and exterior cladding with its natural slip resistance and weather tolerance. Its stability across temperature shifts makes it reliable in both hot and continental climates. Majen supplies blocks optimized for multiple finishes — honed, polished, brushed, tumbled — to match every aesthetic and technical requirement.
ivory.h3: Travertine Block Prices and Cost Factors
ivory.text3: The price of Ivory Travertine Blocks depends on block size, color grade, extraction quality, and order volume. Typical ranges are *USD 190–320 per m³*, with customized dimensions potentially affecting the price per ton. Freight terms (FOB/CIF), packing type, and required certifications may also influence the final quote. Majen follows a transparent pricing policy with detailed itemization, so you always see quarry grade, tonnage, and logistics components clearly. Share your specifications to receive a tailored quotation for your project.
ivory.h4: Travertine Block Sizes & Standard Dimensions
ivory.text4: Standard quarry‑run blocks are typically available up to *3.2 m × 2.0 m × 1.6 m*, subject to bench conditions. Each block is measured, coded, and inspected before loading to ensure dimensional accuracy and optimal yield during slab production. Consistent sizing simplifies nesting and reduces waste in fabrication lines. Whether you need large‑format cladding or smaller architectural details, Majen offers flexible cutting options and batch grouping by tone and vein to maintain aesthetic continuity across projects.
ivory.h5: Travertine Blocks vs Slabs: Which Is Right for You?
ivory.text5: Choose blocks when you need maximum flexibility, better material yield control, and cost efficiency at scale — ideal for quarries, processors, and distributors. Choose *slabs* when you require ready‑to‑install surfaces and faster turnaround for small to medium projects. Blocks minimize per‑m² cost in large fabrication workflows, while slabs reduce on‑site complexity. Majen provides both supply modes so you can balance budget, lead time, and customization based on your production setup and project timeline.

light.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
light.title: Ivory Travertine Blocks
light.intro: Light Travertine Blocks are sourced from leading Turkish quarries and admired for their soft cream tones, subtle veining, and highly workable structure. As a versatile raw material, they can be processed into slabs, tiles, and cut‑to‑size elements for high‑end residential and commercial projects. The stone’s bright color improves light reflection indoors and creates a warm, welcoming aesthetic outdoors. With Majen’s direct quarry access and strict quality selection, every block is delivered with consistent tone, reliable strength, and export‑ready documentation.
light.intro2: Light Travertine is a favorite for luxury villas, hospitality spaces, shopping galleries, and public buildings that require timeless elegance and durability. Indoors, it elevates floors, wall cladding, staircases, and feature walls, pairing well with wood and metal finishes. Outdoors, it performs beautifully on façades, pool decks, terraces, and landscaping paths thanks to its heat resistance and natural slip performance when finished appropriately. Majen supplies finish‑ready blocks to fit honed, brushed, tumbled, polished, filled, or unfilled processes based on your design and technical needs.
light.h3: Travertine Block Prices and Cost Factors
light.text3: Pricing for Light Travertine Blocks depends on block size, tone uniformity, quarry grade, and order volume. Typical market ranges are USD 180–300 per m³, with custom dimensions and premium tone selections potentially influencing the quote per ton. Freight terms (FOB/CIF), packaging type, and requested certifications can also affect final pricing. Majen uses an itemized quotation model that clearly separates material, logistics, and document costs, allowing procurement teams to compare scenarios transparently. Share your specs to receive a tailored offer.
light.h4: Travertine Block Sizes & Standard Dimensions
light.text4: Standard quarry‑run blocks are commonly produced up to 3.2 m × 2.0 m × 1.6 m, subject to bench conditions and safety parameters. Each block is measured, tone‑graded, and code‑labeled before dispatch to maximize yield during slab production. Consistent sizing reduces fabrication waste and simplifies nesting for large façade or flooring packages. For projects requiring strict module continuity, Majen can group blocks by tone and vein to maintain visual harmony across long runs, from entrance halls to exterior elevations.
light.h5: Travertine Blocks vs Slabs: Which Fits Your Workflow?
light.text5: Choose blocks when you manage fabrication lines or need maximum flexibility over thickness, finish, and sizing — this approach optimizes cost per m² at scale. Opt for slabs when installation speed and predictable dimensions are the priority for small and mid‑sized projects. Blocks favor distributors and processors who plan yield across multiple orders, while slabs reduce on‑site complexity for fast‑track schedules. Majen supplies both options, helping teams balance budget, lead time, and customization with dependable logistics.

antico.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
antico.title: Ivory Travertine Blocks
antico.intro: Antico Travertine Blocks are extracted from Turkey’s premium quarries, featuring a distinctive mix of beige, walnut, and cream tones with expressive natural veining. This ancient‑looking travertine offers a rustic and historic feel while maintaining modern durability. Perfect for restoration, classic architecture, and landscape design, Antico Travertine combines traditional character with long‑lasting strength. With Majen’s direct quarry sourcing and global export experience, every block is carefully inspected, graded, and shipped with full documentation and tone consistency.
antico.intro2: Antico Travertine Blocks are highly sought after for restoration projects, heritage buildings, and luxury architectural designs seeking a timeless aesthetic. Indoors, they add warmth and texture to lobbies, staircases, and wall claddings, offering a natural patina that evolves beautifully over time. Outdoors, this stone is ideal for façades, courtyards, pool decks, and garden walls where antique charm meets strength and slip resistance. The stone’s earthy color palette harmonizes with Mediterranean, rustic, and contemporary architectural styles alike, making it one of the most versatile choices for designers and builders.
antico.h3: Travertine Block Prices and Cost Factors
antico.text3: Antico Travertine Blocks typically range from USD 200–340 per m³, depending on size, tone, and quarry selection. Factors like color intensity, vein distribution, and processing requirements may influence the total cost per ton. Majen maintains a transparent pricing structure — offering itemized quotations that separate quarry value, logistics, and certifications. By ordering directly from Majen’s quarry network, clients benefit from competitive pricing, reduced intermediaries, and reliable delivery schedules for both domestic and export shipments.
antico.h4: Travertine Block Sizes & Standard Dimensions
antico.text4: Standard Antico Travertine Blocks are available in sizes up to 3.2 m × 2.0 m × 1.6 m, with smaller or custom‑cut formats available upon request. Each block is tone‑graded, dimension‑checked, and coded for full traceability. Consistency in block size improves yield during slab or tile production, minimizing waste and ensuring efficient cutting. Majen provides custom batch matching for projects requiring continuity of tone and texture, allowing architects and contractors to achieve seamless visual results across both interior and exterior applications.
antico.h5: Travertine Blocks vs Slabs: Which Fits Your Workflow?
antico.text5: Travertine blocks are ideal for processors, exporters, and large fabrication facilities needing flexibility in thickness and finish. Blocks optimize cost per m² and allow for selective processing to match various design goals. Slabs, however, are suitable for ready‑to‑install projects where time and size predictability are critical. For Antico Travertine, blocks preserve the natural raw texture that enhances its antique character, while slabs deliver a refined and polished version of the same tone. Majen supplies both, offering clients the freedom to choose based on project scale and finish preference.

unfilled-honed.h1: What defines unfilled brushed cross cut travertine?
unfilled-honed.title: What defines unfilled brushed cross cut travertine?
unfilled-honed.lead: It combines open natural pores with a soft, brushed surface and cloudy cross-cut patterns for natural depth and texture.
unfilled-honed.intro: It combines open natural pores with a soft, brushed surface and cloudy cross-cut patterns for natural depth and texture.
unfilled-honed.title2: What Is Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
unfilled-honed.intro2: “Vein Cut” exposes the stone’s natural layers, producing linear vein patterns that flow across each slab. “Unfilled” means the pores remain open, preserving texture and breathability. “Honed” refines the surface to a smooth, low-gloss finish without filling the pores—balancing natural roughness with refined aesthetics. This combination provides understated elegance with tactile comfort and timeless authenticity.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Honed Vein Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico color selections to match varied architectural themes. Ivory delivers bright cream warmth; Light offers subtle beige neutrality; Antico adds earthy depth with classic charm. Each tone comes from the same quarry level to ensure consistent hue and vein direction across large spaces. These natural colors emphasize the stone’s organic rhythm and are perfect for balanced, modern environments.

description: Linear veins, open-pore texture, and soft matte finish. A perfect balance of authenticity and refinement—crafted directly at the source in Uşak–Ulubey.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each tone delivers unique character while maintaining color consistency and vein harmony.
Available in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, with precise calibration for tight joints and easy installation. Large slabs maintain vein flow and reduce layout waste.
Primary finish: Honed with unfilled natural pores. Slabs are securely strapped and packed in reinforced wooden crates for safe international shipment.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Honed Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: The unfilled honed finish merges natural authenticity with refined smoothness. The open pores express the material’s origin, while the honed surface enhances comfort and easy cleaning. It provides a matte, low-glare aesthetic ideal for serene interiors and softly illuminated spaces. Majen’s precision calibration ensures a consistent surface feel without losing the natural vein definition that defines Vein Cut Travertine.
TextSection.text2: Use Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs for wall cladding, living spaces, spa zones, and indoor-outdoor transitions. Its balanced matte texture pairs beautifully with wood, concrete, and glass elements. Architects prefer this finish for projects seeking natural sophistication without shine. Combine with brushed or polished travertine in connected areas to add subtle contrast while maintaining design continuity.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses. Large-format slabs enhance vein continuity and visual calm across spaces. Surfaces are precisely calibrated and honed without closing the pores, keeping the natural breathability of travertine intact. Fabrication advice: align veins for directional balance, use breathable sealers, and avoid resin coatings to preserve texture authenticity.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen directly controls quarrying, cutting, and finishing, ensuring unmatched quality consistency. Each slab is hand-inspected for vein alignment, tone grouping, and precise honing. Orders are shipped with full documentation, reinforced wooden crates, and moisture protection under FOB or CIF terms. With a proven export record, Majen provides reliable service and long-term material availability for international projects.
TextSection.header5: Global Export, Maintenance & Standards
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, North America, and the Middle East. All slabs meet ISO standards for thickness, flatness, and surface quality. Routine maintenance requires mild, pH-neutral cleaners and optional breathable sealers. The honed surface gently ages over time, enhancing the natural tone variation that defines authentic travertine aesthetics.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: The polished surface intensifies color and reflects light, enhancing the elegance of linear veins for sophisticated interiors.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Which colors are available?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Ivory, Light, and Antico — each sourced from the same quarry layer for color harmony and vein consistency.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: Is polished travertine suitable for high-traffic areas?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Yes. Filled and polished surfaces resist staining and wear when sealed properly, making them suitable for both residential and commercial interiors.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Use mild pH-neutral cleaners, avoid acidic products, and re-seal annually for long-term gloss protection.

filled-honed.h1: Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-honed.title: Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
filled-honed.lead: Majen supplies Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. The stone is sliced parallel to the bedding layers to reveal elegant, continuous veins; pores are professionally filled to achieve a dense, smooth structure. A precise honed finish delivers a refined matte surface with excellent flatness, color harmony, and slip comfort—ideal for upscale interiors, long corridors, wall cladding, and large-format floors. FOB/CIF worldwide export with reinforced packaging.
filled-honed.intro: Majen supplies Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. The stone is sliced parallel to the bedding layers to reveal elegant, continuous veins; pores are professionally filled to achieve a dense, smooth structure. A precise honed finish delivers a refined matte surface with excellent flatness, color harmony, and slip comfort—ideal for upscale interiors, long corridors, wall cladding, and large-format floors. FOB/CIF worldwide export with reinforced packaging.
filled-honed.intro2: “Vein cut” emphasizes linear bands that flow across the slab; “filled” closes open voids for stability and easy cleaning; “honed” calibrates the surface to a silky, low-gloss sheen. Together they create a balanced, contemporary look that photographs beautifully and performs reliably in high-traffic areas. Majen controls selection, filling, and honing in-house to ensure uniform tone, crisp vein definition, and consistent thickness for predictable installation results.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Filled Honed Vein Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: To match different design palettes, Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Ivory delivers warm cream elegance with gentle, continuous veining; Light provides a neutral beige ideal for minimal interiors; Antico offers a slightly deeper, earthy character for richer contrasts. All colors are curated from the same quarry bench to keep hue and pattern continuity across large areas, enabling vein matching and seamless book-look layouts on walls and floors.

description: Quarry-direct slabs with clear linear veins, professional filling, and premium honing. Tight calibration, color grouping, and export-ready reinforcement deliver predictable, A-grade results.
Choose Ivory, Light, or Antico to match warm, neutral, or deeper palettes. Curated from the same bench for reliable hue harmony and vein continuity across large spaces.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, 5 cm with large-format availability. Flatness and thickness tolerances speed installation and improve vein alignment on floors and walls.
Primary finish: Honed (matte). Alternative accents available on request. Slabs ship in reinforced wooden crates with moisture protection for safe, long-distance freight.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of Filled + Honed for Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Filling increases density, hygiene, and edge strength, while the honed finish ensures comfortable foot feel, low maintenance, and controlled reflection under strong lighting. Combined with linear veins, spaces gain rhythm without glare—perfect for hotels, showrooms, and residential galleries. The matte look softens daylight and artificial light equally, and keeps photography true-to-color. Majen’s calibration limits lippage and speeds installation on expansive floors.
TextSection.text2: Use Filled Honed Vein Cut slabs for interior floors, lobby corridors, wall cladding, stair strings, reception desks, and elevator surrounds. Pair with brushed tiles in adjacent wet areas for texture continuity, or contrast with polished accents on countertops. Linear veins guide circulation in long spaces and emphasize perspective in galleries. Coordinated thresholds and skirtings are available cut-to-size to maintain material language throughout the project.
TextSection.text3: Standard thicknesses are 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm with tight tolerance. Large formats improve layout speed and reduce grout lines; edges are square-cut and micro-beveled on request. Slabs are reinforced where necessary, then inspected for flatness and color grouping before packing. Fabrication notes: align veins along the main axis of movement; pre-dry-lay for book-flow effects; use color-matched grout and flexible adhesives for heavy-use floors.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: As a direct quarry supplier, Majen controls block selection, cutting, filling, honing, and final QC in one workflow. Orders ship under FOB or CIF with packing lists, invoices, and certificates of origin. Crates are strapped, wrapped, and corner-guarded for ocean freight. Dedicated export support, reliable inventory, and responsive sampling help architects and importers deliver on schedule while preserving the design intent of continuous, elegant vein movement.
TextSection.header5: Global Export, Maintenance & Standards
TextSection.text5: Majen exports to Europe, North America, and the Middle East, meeting international tolerances for thickness, flatness, and surface finish. For care, use pH-neutral cleaners and reseal as specified by traffic level; the filled honed surface resists staining and cleans easily. Technical data sheets and recommended sealers are available on request. With steady production and consistent tonality, Majen supports repeat projects and long-term sourcing programs.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Filling increases density and hygiene; honed gives a refined matte look with low glare—ideal for high-traffic interiors that need elegant, continuous veining.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Which colors are available?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Ivory, Light, and Antico—each selected for stable tonality and vein clarity so large areas appear calm and consistent.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: Are these slabs suitable for wet areas?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Yes. Honed surfaces offer comfortable slip behavior; use matched brushed tiles in showers or pool surrounds for extra traction.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: 2 cm for standard interiors, 3 cm for heavier traffic or large steps, 5 cm for special structural pieces; Majen provides fabrication guidance on request.

unfilled-honed.title2: What Is Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
unfilled-honed.intro2: “Vein Cut” exposes the stone’s natural layers, producing linear vein patterns that flow across each slab. “Unfilled” means the pores remain open, preserving texture and breathability. “Honed” refines the surface to a smooth, low-gloss finish without filling the pores—balancing natural roughness with refined aesthetics. This combination provides understated elegance with tactile comfort and timeless authenticity.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Blocks Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine blocks from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Blocks?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

items.a: Its antique texture, warm beige tones, and subtle veining create sophisticated, timeless surfaces suited to both classic and modern designs.
Yes. Brushed or tumbled finishes with proper sealing are recommended for paths, pool decks, and façades.

items.a: In reinforced wooden bundles with interleaves, corner guards, strapping, and moisture-resistant wrapping.

light.intro: Warm beige canvas with gentle movement for bright, welcoming interiors. Popular for kitchens, vanities and hotel lobbies.
light.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Light travertine slabs from Turkey

Favored for counters, wall cladding and reception desks; consistent lots for large areas.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

slabs.title: Wholesale Travertine Slabs | Majen
slabs.desc: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs reveal the natural linear veins of the stone, creating a striking, continuous flow across surfaces. Ideal for wall cladding, flooring, and large-format designs that emphasize movement and depth.
slabs.intro: Majen is a leading exporter of Wholesale Travertine Slabs , supplying 2cm, 3cm, and 5cm slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. Available in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, our travertine slabs are crafted for consistency, durability, and natural elegance. Each slab is carefully cut and inspected to meet A-grade standards, reinforced for international shipment, and trusted by architects and wholesalers worldwide.
slabs.intro2: Turkey is the world’s largest supplier of travertine, and Majen delivers premium selections. Our Wholesale Travertine Slabs offer polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled finishes to suit diverse projects. Quarry-direct sourcing ensures consistent supply and competitive pricing. Importers and designers rely on Majen slabs for residential, commercial, and hospitality projects requiring both strength and timeless beauty.

cuts.heading: Travertine Slabs Cut Options
cuts.text: Majen offers two distinct cutting methods for Travertine Slabs — Vein Cut and Cross Cut  Each option highlights unique patterns and tones, crafted to meet diverse architectural needs.  Choose honed for smooth elegance, brushed or tumbled for rustic texture, and polished for luxury interiors.
description: Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, Majen’s Vein Cut Travertine Slabsdeliver clear, continuous linear veins with reliable color harmony. Each blockis hand-selected, precisely cut, and reinforced for export, ensuring consistentA-grade quality and predictable results on large, directional designs.

Ideal for interiors where flow and rhythm matter: hotel lobbies, long corridors,wall cladding, floors, reception desks, and feature walls. The parallel vein structureenhances spatial continuity and modern aesthetics, while matching tiles allow seamlesstransitions across rooms.

Standard production in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Common large formats are available forefficient fabrication and vein matching across panels. Tight calibration and thicknesscontrol reduce waste, speed installation, and maintain visual continuity in expansivesurfaces.

Available finishes: honed, polished, brushed, tumbled in filled or unfilled options.Slabs are strapped and wrapped in reinforced wooden crates with moisture protectionand corner guards for safe container loading and long-distance sea freight.

seo.title: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs | Premium Wholesale | Majen
seo.description: Premium vein-cut travertine slabs direct from Turkey. Linear veining, filled or unfilled, in honed, polished, brushed, or tumbled finishes. 2cm & 3cm options, custom sizes, reliable export from quarry to site.

vein-cut.title: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
vein-cut.intro: Majen supplies Vein Cut Travertine Slabs sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab showcases elegant linear veins that flow naturally across the surface, creating a refined architectural look ideal for interior walls, flooring, and large commercial projects. With precise cutting, consistent coloration, and global FOB/CIF export options, Majen ensures superior quality and timeless stone aesthetics for international buyers.
vein-cut.intro2: Vein Cut Travertine is produced by slicing the stone parallel to its natural bedding layers, revealing continuous linear veins. This technique creates a directional pattern that enhances architectural balance and spatial continuity. Ideal for modern interiors, facades, and commercial flooring, these slabs combine elegance and durability with consistent coloration and smooth finishing. Majen’s quarry-direct sourcing ensures reliable quality and sustainable export standards.

variants.title: Filled and Unfilled Surface Options
variants.text: Majen’s Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are available in filled and unfilled varieties to match different design needs. Filled slabs are treated with resin or cement for dense, polished surfaces ideal for luxury interiors. Unfilled slabs preserve natural pores, showcasing authentic texture preferred for rustic and outdoor spaces. Every slab is meticulously inspected, reinforced, and documented before shipment to guarantee flawless international delivery.

vein-cut.desc: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs reveal the natural linear veins of the stone, creating a striking, continuous flow across surfaces. Ideal for wall cladding, flooring, and large-format designs that emphasize movement and depth.

TextSection.text1: Choose from honed polished, brushed, or  tumbled finishes to achieve your project’s design goals. Honed surfaces offer a smooth matte appearance, while polished finishes reflect light for a luxurious feel. Brushed and tumbled options enhance texture, providing natural slip resistance and aged aesthetics. Each finish is produced with Majen’s advanced machinery and strict surface calibration standards.
TextSection.header2: Advantages of Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
TextSection.text2: Vein Cut Travertine highlights continuous linear veins that create a sense of movement and visual depth. This directional flow brings dynamic elegance to hotel lobbies, long corridors, and modern architecture. Beyond aesthetics, the stone provides exceptional structural integrity, consistent patterning, and natural insulation. Majen carefully selects blocks with uniform tones, ensuring reliable color matching across large-scale installations.
TextSection.text3: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are widely used in wall cladding, floors, countertops, and facades where directionality enhances architectural flow. Their linear pattern makes them ideal for projects emphasizing continuity, symmetry, and spatial harmony. Designers prefer these slabs in both contemporary and classical environments, achieving timeless visual depth with natural stone warmth.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen operates as a direct quarry supplier, providing full transparency from extraction to delivery. Every block is selected for clarity of vein structure, color consistency, and optimal cutting quality. We provide FOB and CIF shipping terms, complete export documentation, and reinforced wooden crate packaging. With dedicated service and long-term reliability, Majen is trusted by architects, importers, and stone distributors worldwide.
TextSection.header5: Global Markets & Export Reliability
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Vein Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, North America, and the Middle East. Each slab meets international grading standards for thickness, finish, and strength. With efficient logistics, responsive documentation, and consistent inventory, Majen ensures seamless delivery for wholesalers and project developers worldwide. Every order is verified with packing lists, invoices, and certificates of origin.

description: Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry, Majen’s Vein Cut Travertine Slabsdeliver clear, continuous linear veins with reliable color harmony. Each blockis hand-selected, precisely cut, and reinforced for export, ensuring consistentA-grade quality and predictable results on large, directional designs.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq_span1: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: Why choose Vein Cut Travertine over Cross Cut?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: Vein Cut Travertine reveals continuous parallel veins, offering dynamic visual movement and elegance. It’s ideal for contemporary interiors seeking direction and flow, whereas Cross Cut provides a more clouded, uniform pattern.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: What finishes are available for Vein Cut Travertine Slabs?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Majen offers polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled finishes, in both filled and unfilled options. Each finish is processed to meet global export quality standards and client specifications.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: Are these slabs suitable for outdoor use?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Yes. Unfilled, brushed, or tumbled finishes are perfect for outdoor facades and terraces, combining durability with natural slip resistance.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: What is the standard thickness of Vein Cut Slabs?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Majen produces Vein Cut Slabs in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses. Custom dimensions can be arranged for special architectural or commercial projects.

seo.title: Unilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs – Quarry Supplier from Turkey | Majen
seo.description: Discover Unilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs with mirror gloss, filled structure, and continuous linear veins. Ivory, Light, and Antico colors available for worldwide export.

natural.h1: Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
natural.title: Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
natural.lead: Majen supplies Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Cut parallel to the natural bedding layers, each slab reveals elegant continuous veins while preserving the stone’s open pores and authentic texture. This unfilled natural finish highlights the raw beauty of travertine, offering a tactile surface and soft matte tone ideal for rustic interiors, spa zones, and outdoor architecture. Durable, breathable, and visually organic—crafted for timeless design.
natural.intro: Majen supplies Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Cut parallel to the natural bedding layers, each slab reveals elegant continuous veins while preserving the stone’s open pores and authentic texture. This unfilled natural finish highlights the raw beauty of travertine, offering a tactile surface and soft matte tone ideal for rustic interiors, spa zones, and outdoor architecture. Durable, breathable, and visually organic—crafted for timeless design.
natural.title2: What Is Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine?
natural.intro2: “Vein Cut” exposes the stone’s natural linear veins running through each slab. “Unfilled” leaves the pores open for an authentic look and enhanced texture. This finish maintains natural breathability and a raw aesthetic, making it highly valued in Mediterranean and eco-friendly architecture. Majen hand-selects each block to ensure uniform coloration, accurate calibration, and true natural structure across large projects.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Natural Vein Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico tones to complement diverse architectural styles. Ivory provides subtle cream warmth perfect for open, bright interiors. Light offers a balanced beige neutrality suited for modern and minimalist design. Antico, with deeper earthy character, adds natural contrast for rustic and historical projects. All colors are sourced from the same quarry bench to ensure perfect hue and vein harmony throughout installations.

description: Authentic linear veins with natural pores left open for tactile texture and organic appearance. Sustainably sourced, durable, and suitable for both rustic and modern projects.
Offered in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm. Large formats available for continuous vein alignment and easy installation.
Primary finish: Natural (Unfilled) with matte texture. Packed securely in reinforced wooden crates for worldwide export.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Natural Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Leaving travertine unfilled preserves its natural air pockets and organic texture. This approach provides a more natural slip resistance, enhances tactile depth, and expresses the raw geological origin of the material. Unfilled surfaces also promote better grip underfoot, especially in humid environments. Majen’s precise calibration ensures even thickness and minimal variation without compromising the stone’s authentic character.
TextSection.text2: Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are ideal for outdoor terraces, facades, spa areas, garden walkways, and rustic interiors. They can be used in both vertical and horizontal applications where natural texture is desired. Pair with filled or brushed surfaces in adjacent spaces for contrast and practical performance. Designers often combine unfilled slabs with natural wood, concrete, and metal to highlight organic authenticity in modern contexts.
TextSection.text3: Available in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses, with large-format slabs that preserve vein direction and continuity. All slabs are dimensionally stable and precisely calibrated for easy installation. Edges can be left raw or eased for a softened touch. For fabrication, use breathable sealers to maintain natural feel; avoid heavy resin coatings. Majen’s careful handling preserves each slab’s natural surface integrity during processing and packaging.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen controls the entire process—from quarry selection to export—ensuring true natural quality and consistency. Each unfilled slab is inspected for surface stability, color harmony, and linear vein clarity. We offer FOB/CIF terms with reinforced wooden crates, certificates of origin, and full export documentation. Our long-standing expertise in natural stone export guarantees reliability, transparency, and sustainable sourcing for global projects.

All slabs are dimensionally stable and precisely calibrated for easy installation. Edges can be left raw or eased for a softened touch. For fabrication, use breathable sealers to maintain natural feel; avoid heavy resin coatings. Majen’s careful handling preserves each slab’s natural surface integrity during processing and packaging.

ivory.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright ivory tone.
ivory.h1: Ivory Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.title: Ivory Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.intro: Ivory Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs celebrate the stone in its most elemental state. The creamy beige palette, linear veining, and unfilled pores deliver authentic texture and visual depth, ideal for architecture that values raw material honesty. The natural face keeps reflectivity low for calm, elegant interiors and covered exterior spaces. Carefully selected from leading Turkish quarries, Majen supplies tone‑matched slabs with calibrated thickness, ensuring reliable performance and seamless continuity across large‑scale installations.
ivory.intro2: Unfilled natural travertine is favored where tactile presence and organic warmth are essential. Indoors, it enriches feature walls, gallery corridors, staircases, and living areas with nuanced texture and biophilic appeal. In covered exteriors, it suits façades, loggias, and colonnades that benefit from low sheen and directional patterning. Designers pair Ivory Unfilled with wood, limewash, bronze, and linen palettes to achieve understated luxury. Proper sealing maintains hygiene while preserving the stone’s authentic, breathable look and feel.
ivory.text3: Ivory Unfilled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Typical price ranges are USD 18–40 per m² for 2 cm and USD 28–50 per m² for 3 cm, depending on selection grade, tone uniformity, and order volume. Unfilled processing reduces finishing costs while emphasizing material authenticity. Majen issues transparent, itemized quotations that separate material, sealing options, and logistics — enabling precise budgeting and apples‑to‑apples comparisons for procurement teams.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Unfilled • Natural Face • Vein Cut
ivory.text4: Unfilled: Pores remain open for a breathable, tactile surface with pronounced character; sealing recommended by use case. Natural Face: Raw matte topography retains subtle relief and low reflectance for calm visual fields. Vein Cut: Parallel slicing to bedding reveals orderly linear veining that guides sightlines and accentuates proportion. Together, these attributes produce a quietly dramatic surface — minimal yet richly textural — suited to refined contemporary and heritage‑aware design.
ivory.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Unfilled vs Filled
ivory.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut creates directional rhythm for corridors and axial spaces; cross cut offers cloudy variation for softer visuals. Unfilled vs Filled: Unfilled maximizes natural texture and breathability; filled delivers smoother, easier‑to‑clean surfaces. Choose unfilled for statement walls and covered exteriors; select filled for bathrooms or high‑maintenance zones requiring closed pores.

light.metaDesc: High-gloss luxury look with bright light tone.
light.h1: Light Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
light.title: Light Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
light.intro: Light Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs showcase the authentic beauty of natural stone in its most minimal form. With gentle cream tones, soft linear veining, and a natural matte texture, this travertine embodies quiet luxury and timeless simplicity. The filled structure strengthens the surface and simplifies cleaning, while the untouched natural finish preserves the raw character of the stone. Majen’s precise cutting and selection guarantee consistent tone, accurate sizing, and export-quality preparation for interior and exterior projects.
light.intro2: These slabs are ideal for projects that embrace calm, natural aesthetics — from modern minimal interiors to organic outdoor environments. Indoors, they are perfect for living rooms, walls, corridors, and spa retreats, offering understated warmth and balance. Outdoors, the natural texture blends harmoniously with wood, concrete, and glass, complementing terraces, courtyards, and covered walkways. Designers favor Light Natural Travertine for biophilic spaces where subtle texture, light diffusion, and natural authenticity are key.
light.text3: Light Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are offered in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Average prices range from USD 19–42 per m² for 2 cm and USD 29–52 per m² for 3 cm slabs, depending on color grading, selection uniformity, and order volume. Natural finishes reduce processing costs while maintaining structural performance. Majen provides clear, itemized quotations separating material, finishing, and logistics — ensuring transparent budgeting and easy cost management for architects and buyers.
light.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Natural Face • Vein Cut
light.text4: Filled: Cavities are resin-filled for a smooth, durable surface that minimizes absorption. Natural Face: The surface is left in its raw state, providing organic texture and a low-gloss matte look. Vein Cut: Sliced parallel to bedding layers to reveal continuous linear veining that enhances visual flow. This combination balances the authenticity of natural stone with everyday practicality and enduring beauty.
light.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Natural vs Honed/Brushed
light.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut emphasizes horizontal motion and direction, ideal for long corridors and wide panels; cross cut delivers cloudy transitions for softer variation. Natural vs Honed/Brushed: Natural finish maintains raw tactile charm; honed is smoother and minimal; brushed adds soft texture. Choose natural for understated, contemporary projects where authenticity and texture matter most.

antico.h1: Antico Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
antico.title: Antico Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
antico.intro: Antico Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs reveal the raw elegance of natural stone while offering modern reliability. Warm beige and walnut undertones flow through linear veins, creating a calm, heritage-inspired rhythm across large surfaces. The filled structure closes pores for easier maintenance and long-term performance, while the natural face preserves tactile honesty and low-glare comfort. Carefully selected and calibrated by Majen, each slab delivers tone consistency, precise thickness, and export-ready packaging for premium architectural work.
antico.intro2: Designed for projects seeking authentic texture and timeless warmth, Antico Natural Travertine suits luxury residences, boutique hotels, and sensitive restorations alike. Indoors, the matte, natural face enhances lobbies, corridors, staircases, and feature walls with earthy sophistication. In covered exteriors, vein-cut alignment introduces gentle directionality for façades and colonnades. The rustic palette pairs beautifully with wood, bronze, and textured textiles, enabling designers to craft grounded, biophilic spaces that age gracefully.
antico.text3: Antico Filled Natural Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses. Typical market ranges are USD 22–46 per m² for 2 cm and USD 32–56 per m² for 3 cm, depending on selection grade, tone continuity, and order volume. Natural-face processing keeps reflectivity low while maintaining structural integrity, making it a cost-efficient option for large-format flooring and cladding. Majen provides itemized quotes separating material, finishing, and logistics for transparent procurement.
antico.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Natural Face • Vein Cut
antico.text4: Filled: Cavities are resin-filled to reduce absorption and simplify cleaning without altering the stone’s character. Natural Face: Preserves subtle topography and matte tactility, ideal for low-glare interiors and calm visual schemes. Vein Cut: Parallel slicing along bedding layers reveals orderly, linear veins that guide movement and emphasize proportion. Together, these elements create a durable, understated surface that balances authenticity with project-ready performance.
antico.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Natural vs Honed/Brushed
antico.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut delivers structured, directional flow; cross cut shows cloud-like, organic variation. Choose vein cut for corridors, galleries, and façades seeking visual alignment. Natural vs Honed/Brushed: Natural retains raw tactility; honed is smoother and minimal; brushed adds soft relief for extra grip. Specify natural when authenticity, low sheen, and heritage tone are priorities.

unfilled-honed.h1: Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-honed.title: Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
unfilled-honed.lead: Majen supplies Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the natural bedding layers, revealing continuous linear veins while maintaining the natural pores unfilled for authentic texture. The honed finish softens the surface to a smooth, matte appearance that highlights color harmony and natural patterns. Ideal for elegant, organic interiors and outdoor applications where natural breathability and sophistication meet.
unfilled-honed.intro: Majen supplies Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. Each slab is cut parallel to the natural bedding layers, revealing continuous linear veins while maintaining the natural pores unfilled for authentic texture. The honed finish softens the surface to a smooth, matte appearance that highlights color harmony and natural patterns. Ideal for elegant, organic interiors and outdoor applications where natural breathability and sophistication meet.
unfilled-honed.title2: What Is Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
unfilled-honed.intro2: “Vein Cut” exposes the stone’s natural layers, producing linear vein patterns that flow across each slab. “Unfilled” means the pores remain open, preserving texture and breathability. “Honed” refines the surface to a smooth, low-gloss finish without filling the pores—balancing natural roughness with refined aesthetics. This combination provides understated elegance with tactile comfort and timeless authenticity.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Honed Vein Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico color selections to match varied architectural themes. Ivory delivers bright cream warmth; Light offers subtle beige neutrality; Antico adds earthy depth with classic charm. Each tone comes from the same quarry level to ensure consistent hue and vein direction across large spaces. These natural colors emphasize the stone’s organic rhythm and are perfect for balanced, modern environments.

description: Linear veins, open-pore texture, and soft matte finish. A perfect balance of authenticity and refinement—crafted directly at the source in Uşak–Ulubey.
Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Each tone delivers unique character while maintaining color consistency and vein harmony.
Available in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm, with precise calibration for tight joints and easy installation. Large slabs maintain vein flow and reduce layout waste.
Premium polished finish with sealed pores for a high-end look. Slabs are packed in reinforced wooden crates with corner guards for safe international shipping.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of the Unfilled Honed Finish on Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: The unfilled honed finish merges natural authenticity with refined smoothness. The open pores express the material’s origin, while the honed surface enhances comfort and easy cleaning. It provides a matte, low-glare aesthetic ideal for serene interiors and softly illuminated spaces. Majen’s precision calibration ensures a consistent surface feel without losing the natural vein definition that defines Vein Cut Travertine.
TextSection.text2: Use Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs for wall cladding, living spaces, spa zones, and indoor-outdoor transitions. Its balanced matte texture pairs beautifully with wood, concrete, and glass elements. Architects prefer this finish for projects seeking natural sophistication without shine. Combine with brushed or polished travertine in connected areas to add subtle contrast while maintaining design continuity.
TextSection.text3: Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm thicknesses. Large-format slabs enhance vein continuity and visual calm across spaces. Surfaces are precisely calibrated and honed without closing the pores, keeping the natural breathability of travertine intact. Fabrication advice: align veins for directional balance, use breathable sealers, and avoid resin coatings to preserve texture authenticity.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: Majen directly controls quarrying, cutting, and finishing, ensuring unmatched quality consistency. Each slab is hand-inspected for vein alignment, tone grouping, and precise honing. Orders are shipped with full documentation, reinforced wooden crates, and moisture protection under FOB or CIF terms. With a proven export record, Majen provides reliable service and long-term material availability for international projects.
TextSection.header5: Global Export, Maintenance & Standards
TextSection.text5: Majen exports Unfilled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs to Europe, North America, and the Middle East. All slabs meet ISO standards for thickness, flatness, and surface quality. Routine maintenance requires mild, pH-neutral cleaners and optional breathable sealers. The honed surface gently ages over time, enhancing the natural tone variation that defines authentic travertine aesthetics.

A precise honed finish delivers a refined matte surface with excellent flatness, color harmony, and slip comfort—ideal for upscale interiors, long corridors, wall cladding, and large-format floors. filled-honed.intro: Majen supplies Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry in Turkey. The stone is sliced parallel to the bedding layers to reveal elegant, continuous veins; pores are professionally filled to achieve a dense, smooth structure. A precise honed finish delivers a refined matte surface with excellent flatness, color harmony, and slip comfort—ideal for upscale interiors, long corridors, wall cladding, and large-format floors. FOB/CIF worldwide export with reinforced packaging.
filled-honed.intro2: “Vein cut” emphasizes linear bands that flow across the slab; “filled” closes open voids for stability and easy cleaning; “honed” calibrates the surface to a silky, low-gloss sheen. Together they create a balanced, contemporary look that photographs beautifully and performs reliably in high-traffic areas. Majen controls selection, filling, and honing in-house to ensure uniform tone, crisp vein definition, and consistent thickness for predictable installation results.

detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Filled Honed Vein Cut?

variants.title: Color Options: Ivory, Light, and Antico
variants.text: To match different design palettes, Majen offers Ivory, Light, and Antico tones. Ivory delivers warm cream elegance with gentle, continuous veining; Light provides a neutral beige ideal for minimal interiors; Antico offers a slightly deeper, earthy character for richer contrasts. All colors are curated from the same quarry bench to keep hue and pattern continuity across large areas, enabling vein matching and seamless book-look layouts on walls and floors.

description: Quarry-direct slabs with clear linear veins, professional filling, and premium honing. Tight calibration, color grouping, and export-ready reinforcement deliver predictable, A-grade results.
Choose Ivory, Light, or Antico to match warm, neutral, or deeper palettes. Curated from the same bench for reliable hue harmony and vein continuity across large spaces.
Produced in 2 cm, 3 cm, 5 cm with large-format availability. Flatness and thickness tolerances speed installation and improve vein alignment on floors and walls.
Primary finish: Honed (matte). Alternative accents available on request. Slabs ship in reinforced wooden crates with moisture protection for safe, long-distance freight.

TextSection.header1: Advantages of Filled + Honed for Vein Cut Slabs
TextSection.text1: Filling increases density, hygiene, and edge strength, while the honed finish ensures comfortable foot feel, low maintenance, and controlled reflection under strong lighting. Combined with linear veins, spaces gain rhythm without glare—perfect for hotels, showrooms, and residential galleries. The matte look softens daylight and artificial light equally, and keeps photography true-to-color. Majen’s calibration limits lippage and speeds installation on expansive floors.
TextSection.text2: Use Filled Honed Vein Cut slabs for interior floors, lobby corridors, wall cladding, stair strings, reception desks, and elevator surrounds. Pair with brushed tiles in adjacent wet areas for texture continuity, or contrast with polished accents on countertops. Linear veins guide circulation in long spaces and emphasize perspective in galleries. Coordinated thresholds and skirtings are available cut-to-size to maintain material language throughout the project.
TextSection.text3: Standard thicknesses are 2 cm, 3 cm, and 5 cm with tight tolerance. Large formats improve layout speed and reduce grout lines; edges are square-cut and micro-beveled on request. Slabs are reinforced where necessary, then inspected for flatness and color grouping before packing. Fabrication notes: align veins along the main axis of movement; pre-dry-lay for book-flow effects; use color-matched grout and flexible adhesives for heavy-use floors.
TextSection.header4: Why Choose Majen for Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text4: As a direct quarry supplier, Majen controls block selection, cutting, filling, honing, and final QC in one workflow. Orders ship under FOB or CIF with packing lists, invoices, and certificates of origin. Crates are strapped, wrapped, and corner-guarded for ocean freight. Dedicated export support, reliable inventory, and responsive sampling help architects and importers deliver on schedule while preserving the design intent of continuous, elegant vein movement.
TextSection.header5: Global Export, Maintenance & Standards
TextSection.text5: Majen exports to Europe, North America, and the Middle East, meeting international tolerances for thickness, flatness, and surface finish. For care, use pH-neutral cleaners and reseal as specified by traffic level; the filled honed surface resists staining and cleans easily. Technical data sheets and recommended sealers are available on request. With steady production and consistent tonality, Majen supports repeat projects and long-term sourcing programs.

ivory.h1: Ivory Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs
ivory.title: Ivory Travertine Slabs
ivory.intro: Ivory Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Slabs deliver a refined, contemporary look with consistent linear veining and a smooth, low‑gloss surface. The filled pores create a seamless feel ideal for high‑traffic interiors, while the honed finish reduces glare and highlights the stone’s warm beige tone. Sourced from leading Turkish quarries and processed to tight tolerances, these slabs are engineered for easy fabrication and color continuity across large areas. Majen supplies multiple thicknesses with export‑ready packaging and flexible logistics for global projects.
ivory.intro2: This finish and cut combination excels in residential and commercial spaces that demand both elegance and practicality. Indoors, slabs perform beautifully on floors, walls, bathrooms, and kitchen splashbacks, pairing well with metal, wood, and glass details. In hospitality and retail environments, the calm honed surface supports a premium ambience without visual noise. For covered exteriors, vein cut geometry delivers striking linear movement on façades and columns. Architects choose this specification to achieve modern lines, uniform color, and easy maintenance in daily use.
ivory.text3: TPricing is influenced by slab thickness, grade, and selection consistency. Common thicknesses include 2 cm and 3 cm, with custom options available for specialty applications. Standard slab formats support efficient nesting in fabrication and minimize waste for large flooring runs. Typical price ranges are USD 22–45 per m² for 2 cm and USD 32–58 per m² for 3 cm depending on tone, finish quality, and order volume. Majen provides transparent, itemized quotes that separate material, finishing, and logistics so procurement teams can compare scenarios precisely.
ivory.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Honed • Vein Cut
ivory.text4: Filled: micro‑pore cavities are filled for a smooth, hygienic surface suitable for bathrooms and kitchens. Honed: a matte, low‑reflection finish that emphasizes warmth and texture while resisting fingerprints and glare. Vein Cut: slicing parallel to the bedding creates directional, linear veining ideal for modern, continuous designs. Combined, these properties deliver a balanced surface with reliable slip behavior indoors and a uniform visual rhythm. For outdoor or wet zones, specify appropriate sealing and R‑rating according to local code and usage conditions.
ivory.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Filled vs Unfilled
ivory.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut yields linear movement and tonal stripes; cross cut reveals cloud‑like patterns and softer transitions. Choose vein cut for corridors and large runs where directionality guides the eye; choose cross cut for calmer, diffuse visuals. Filled vs Unfilled: Filled surfaces are smooth and easy to clean; unfilled maintains natural texture and additional traction. For wet indoor areas, filled + honed offers hygiene and maintenance advantages; for rustic or exterior looks, unfilled may suit better with proper sealing.

With their soft cream-beige tone and finely linear veining, they reflect light beautifully while maintaining the warmth of natural stone. The filled surface ensures a flawless, seamless texture, while the polished finish enhances color depth and visual brilliance. Majen’s expert quarry selection and polishing techniques deliver unmatched quality, consistent tone, and mirror-smooth precision for global luxury projects.
light.intro2: These slabs are a top choice for modern interiors that seek natural brightness and elegant reflection. Perfect for hotel lobbies, residential flooring, reception halls, and vertical wall cladding, they elevate any environment with refined light diffusion. The vein-cut structure creates a dynamic sense of movement across large spaces, complementing minimalist and Mediterranean design aesthetics alike. In commercial spaces, the polished surface amplifies perceived area size, creating a luxurious yet timeless visual effect.
light.text3: Light Filled Polished Vein Cut Travertine Slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses, calibrated for precision and durability. light.text4: Filled: Surface pores are filled with high-performance resin for a smooth and hygienic texture, ideal for interior spaces. light.h5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut • Filled vs Unfilled
light.text5: Vein Cut vs Cross Cut: Vein cut showcases elegant horizontal lines, perfect for directional design and optical balance; cross cut emphasizes softer, more organic patterns. Polished vs Honed: Polished surfaces reflect light and enrich color depth for grand interiors, while honed offers subtle sophistication. unfilled-polished.title2: What Is Unfilled Polished Vein Cut Travertine?
unfilled-polished.intro2: “Vein Cut” reveals the stone’s natural linear structure, creating an elegant directional flow. “Unfilled” maintains the stone’s open pores, preserving authenticity and natural breathability. “Polished” amplifies the color depth and gives the surface high reflectivity, offering both luxury and uniqueness. detailsHeadings.title1: Why Our Unfilled Polished Vein Cut?
