QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Yes, Majen exports worldwide with secure packaging, full documentation, and CIF/FOB shipping options.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: What are the benefits of filled honed finish?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: It increases strength, improves texture, minimizes porosity, and offers a refined matte look with easy maintenance.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Regular sealing and gentle cleaning help preserve surface texture and prevent stains in outdoor environments.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_header: Is this finish suitable for both indoor and outdoor use?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_text: Yes, filled honed travertine is perfect for pool decks, patios, and even indoor flooring due to its smooth yet durable surface.

seo.title: Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Pavers | Global Supplier of Polished Outdoor Stone
seo.description: Filled honed vein cut travertine pavers for pool decks and patios. Smooth texture, sealed durability, and global export by Majen.

filled-natural.h1: Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Pavers
filled-natural.title: Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Pavers
filled-natural.lead: Filled honed vein cut travertine pavers combine the linear elegance of vein cutting with the smooth satin feel of a honed surface. The filling process seals the stone’s natural pores, increasing strength and reducing maintenance. Perfect for patios, pool decks, and terraces, these pavers provide a sleek yet natural look that enhances outdoor luxury projects worldwide.
filled-natural.intro: Filled honed vein cut travertine pavers combine the linear elegance of vein cutting with the smooth satin feel of a honed surface. The filling process seals the stone’s natural pores, increasing strength and reducing maintenance. Perfect for patios, pool decks, and terraces, these pavers provide a sleek yet natural look that enhances outdoor luxury projects worldwide.
filled-natural.title2: The Beauty of Filled Honed Travertine Finish
filled-natural.intro2: The honed finish offers a soft matte surface that reflects minimal light, giving spaces a calm and refined atmosphere. Filling the stone enhances density and creates a smooth, pore-free surface, making it ideal for outdoor flooring where comfort and elegance meet durability. Each tile is precisely cut and calibrated for a seamless, high-end appearance.

variants.title: Surface Characteristics and Texture
variants.text: The honed finish gives the stone a soft, satin touch while reducing glare, perfect for contemporary designs seeking a calm aesthetic. The filled process eliminates natural cavities, providing smoother texture and easier maintenance. Majen ensures each slab is processed with precision calibration, resulting in consistent tone, thickness, and seamless installation for high-end international projects.

description: The honed finish delivers a soft satin texture and subtle reflection, creating a calm atmosphere perfect for contemporary landscapes and interiors.
Filling the stone’s natural pores improves density and resistance to moisture and wear — ensuring long-lasting strength in demanding outdoor conditions.
Available in 8″×8″, 12″×12″, 12″×24″, 16″×16″, 18″×18″, 24″×24″, 24″×48″, 48″×110″, and Versailles Set sizes — precision-cut for seamless installation and superior alignment.
Eco-conscious quarrying and energy-efficient processing minimize environmental impact while maintaining world-class stone quality.

TextSection.text1: Filled honed vein cut travertine is ideal for interior flooring, wall cladding, bathrooms, lobbies, and countertops. Its linear vein structure complements both modern and classical architecture. Designers appreciate its balance of warmth, texture, and durability — making it suitable for luxury villas, commercial buildings, and hospitality projects that require both visual harmony and practical resilience.
TextSection.text2: Majen offers a complete range of filled honed vein cut travertine tile sizes, including: 8″×8″, 12″×12″, 12″×24″, 16″×16″, 18″×18″, 24″×24″, 24″×48″, 48″×110″, and Versailles Set. These standardized formats ensure flexibility for flooring patterns and wall applications. Large-size slabs are ideal for achieving continuity in expansive spaces, while smaller cuts offer refined detailing for compact areas. Custom dimensions are available upon request.
TextSection.text3: Majen’s filled honed vein cut travertine tiles feature light beige, ivory, and cream tones, enhanced by the directional movement of vein patterns. The filled surface preserves the stone’s natural essence while creating a uniform, modern appearance. Subtle color variations across slabs add depth and sophistication, making every installation unique and naturally harmonious.
TextSection.header4: Maintenance & Performance
TextSection.text4: Filled honed travertine requires minimal maintenance. Regular cleaning with pH-neutral stone cleaner keeps the surface pristine, while periodic resealing enhances protection. The filled surface minimizes water absorption, making it ideal for high-moisture areas. With proper care, Majen’s tiles retain their smooth finish and refined tone for decades in both residential and commercial spaces.
TextSection.header5: Why Choose Majen as Your Trusted Export Partner?
TextSection.text5: Majen operates as a direct quarry supplier, providing total control over extraction, cutting, and finishing. Each tile is inspected for vein consistency, color tone, and surface density. With FOB and CIF export options, reinforced packaging, and global logistics expertise, Majen ensures safe and efficient worldwide delivery — trusted by architects, importers, and developers across continents.

Each tile is filled for superior strength, honed for a smooth satin-matte finish, and vein-cut to accentuate elegant linear motion. The expansive 24″x48″ format minimizes grout lines, offering seamless visual flow and luxury aesthetics. Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico, this premium stone defines modern natural elegance.
24x48.intro: Majen’s 24″x48″ Honed Vein Cut Travertine Tiles bring monumental scale and refined continuity to architectural design. Each tile is filled for superior strength, honed for a smooth satin-matte finish, and vein-cut to accentuate elegant linear motion. The expansive 24″x48″ format minimizes grout lines, offering seamless visual flow and luxury aesthetics. Available in Ivory, Light, and Antico, this premium stone defines modern natural elegance.
24x48.intro2: 24″x48″ Filled Honed Vein Cut Travertine Tiles are ideal for hotel lobbies, office spaces, open-concept villas, galleries, and spa environments. The large rectangular size enhances continuity and architectural balance. The filled surface ensures density and stability, while the honed finish creates a soft tactile experience. These tiles combine natural beauty with structural precision for high-end residential and commercial spaces.
24x48.text3: Majen supplies 24″x48″ travertine tiles in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses suitable for both walls and flooring applications. 💵 Average Export Pricing: USD 30–55/m² (2 cm) USD 40–65/m² (3 cm) Pricing depends on tone consistency, order size, and finish customization. Each tile is precision-cut, tone-calibrated, and inspected to meet global architectural standards. The honed finish enhances durability while maintaining elegant, matte sophistication.
24x48.h4: Technical Features: Filled • Honed • Vein Cut
24x48.text4: Filled: Natural pores sealed with premium resin, creating a smooth, dense surface for structural durability. Honed: Non-reflective matte surface ideal for soft light diffusion and a contemporary aesthetic. Vein Cut: Linear cut reveals consistent veins and visual flow, guiding movement across large surfaces. Together, these features deliver timeless beauty, smooth tactility, and superior performance for large-scale architectural projects.
24x48.text5: Ivory: Creamy beige hue with soft, elegant linear veining, brightening expansive interiors with natural warmth. Light: Subtle beige-gray with calm transitions and minimal contrast — perfect for modern minimalist architecture. Antico: Rich beige-brown tone with softly aged character and depth — ideal for Mediterranean, rustic, or classic interiors. Each color selection is tone-matched and batch-calibrated to ensure uniformity across large installations.

The honed matte surface provides subtle sophistication, while the filled structure ensures long-term durability. Perfect for designers seeking scale, continuity, and natural refinement.
48x110.text3: Majen’s 48″x110″ travertine slabs are available in 2 cm and 3 cm thicknesses, engineered for both wall and floor applications. 💵 Average Export Pricing: USD 40–70/m² (2 cm) USD 50–85/m² (3 cm) Pricing depends on tone consistency, block selection, and export logistics. seo.title: Cross Cut Travertine Pavers | Global Supplier of Natural Outdoor Stone
seo.description: Elegant cross cut travertine pavers for patios, pool decks, and walkways. Uniform texture, soft tones, and global export by Majen.

cross-cut.desc: Vein Cut Travertine Slabs reveal the natural linear veins of the stone, creating a striking, continuous flow across surfaces. Ideal for wall cladding, flooring, and large-format designs that emphasize movement and depth.
cross-cut.title: Cross Cut Travertine Pavers
cross-cut.intro: Cross cut travertine pavers are known for their soft, cloudy patterns and consistent texture, created by slicing the stone perpendicular to its natural veins. This technique results in a uniform look, ideal for contemporary outdoor surfaces. Majen supplies globally, offering high-quality cross cut pavers that deliver durability, visual balance, and timeless beauty for landscape projects.
cross-cut.intro2: Unlike vein cut travertine, cross cut pavers highlight natural color blending rather than linear patterns. The result is a soft, balanced appearance suitable for minimalist and modern designs. Its subtle tones make it a preferred option for pool decks, patios, and garden paths where uniformity and elegance are key.

variants.title: Surface Finishes and Design Options
variants.text: Majen’s vein-cut travertine is available in a wide range of surface finishes: honed, polished, brushed, tumbled, and natural. Each finish transforms the texture and feel of the stone to suit different design goals — from sleek, contemporary looks to rustic, aged aesthetics. Our slabs are produced with advanced calibration standards to ensure smooth surfaces, precise thickness, and consistent color tones for global projects.

description: Cross cut travertine reveals balanced tones and patterns, making it perfect for minimalist outdoor designs and wide open areas.
Naturally textured surfaces enhance grip, ensuring safety and comfort in pool decks and wet environments.
Soft beige, ivory, and silver-gray tones blend seamlessly, providing visual calm for modern outdoor spaces.
Dense and weather-resistant, cross cut travertine endures heavy foot traffic and extreme climates with ease.

TextSection.text1: Majen ensures reliable supply and consistent grading for cross cut travertine pavers. Each paver is carefully inspected for tone consistency, thickness accuracy, and precise cutting. With FOB and CIF export terms, we deliver safely packed consignments worldwide. Our quarry-direct sourcing guarantees premium quality and efficient delivery to global distributors and contractors.
TextSection.text2: Filled cross cut travertine pavers feature smooth, dense surfaces with minimal porosity. Available finishes include Honed, Polished, Brushed, Tumbled, and Natural. These pavers provide an elegant, easy-to-clean look ideal for refined outdoor and indoor settings. Filled finishes enhance color depth and resistance to external elements.
TextSection.text3: Unfilled cross cut travertine retains its authentic natural pores, offering rustic charm and excellent traction. Finishes include Natural, Honed, Polished, Brushed, and Tumbled. These surfaces are best suited for outdoor areas like gardens, terraces, and walkways where natural drainage and grip are crucial.
TextSection.header4: Applications in Outdoor Design
TextSection.text4: Cross cut travertine pavers are widely used in luxury landscaping, resorts, and residential architecture. Their neutral tones and fine-grain texture harmonize beautifully with both modern and traditional designs. Ideal for pool surrounds, patios, and driveways, they combine timeless style with enduring performance in every climate.
TextSection.header5: Why Choose Majen for Cross Cut Travertine?
TextSection.text5: Partnering with Majen means working with a globally recognized exporter specializing in premium travertine. From quarry selection to final shipment, every step is quality controlled. Our global network, competitive pricing, and commitment to consistency make Majen the reliable choice for long-term supply partnerships.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq_span1: Cross-Cut
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What is cross cut travertine?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: It’s a type of travertine cut perpendicular to the natural vein, producing soft, cloud-like patterns and uniform texture.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: What are the available finishes for cross cut travertine pavers?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Honed, polished, brushed, tumbled, and natural — in both filled and unfilled options.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: Do you export cross cut travertine pavers worldwide?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Yes. Majen exports globally using reinforced packaging and FOB/CIF shipping terms.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: How does cross cut differ from vein cut travertine?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Cross cut has a softer, more uniform pattern, while vein cut shows linear vein lines for a bold appearance.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_header: Are cross cut travertine pavers suitable for outdoor use?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Yes, they’re ideal for outdoor flooring, patios, and pool decks due to their slip resistance and durability.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_header: Can I order custom sizes and thicknesses?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_text: Of course. Custom dimensions and finishes are available for bulk and architectural projects.

seo.title: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles | Natural Matte Elegance – Majen
seo.description: Majen’s unfilled honed cross cut travertine tiles feature open pores, matte finish, and cloudy texture. Modern, natural, and globally exported for luxury interiors.

unfilled-honed.h1: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles
unfilled-honed.title: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles
unfilled-honed.lead: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles by Majen blend natural authenticity with refined matte elegance. Each tile retains its open pores for organic depth, while the honed finish delivers a smooth, velvety texture. The cloudy cross-cut pattern adds a soft, natural rhythm, making these tiles ideal for contemporary and minimalist interiors that value calm and timeless sophistication.
unfilled-honed.intro: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles by Majen blend natural authenticity with refined matte elegance. Each tile retains its open pores for organic depth, while the honed finish delivers a smooth, velvety texture. The cloudy cross-cut pattern adds a soft, natural rhythm, making these tiles ideal for contemporary and minimalist interiors that value calm and timeless sophistication.
unfilled-honed.title2: What Are Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles?
unfilled-honed.intro2: Unfilled honed travertine is produced by cutting the stone across its bedding layers to expose cloudy patterns, then honing the surface for a soft matte feel. The open pores remain visible, enhancing natural character. This combination creates a balanced texture that feels grounded yet modern — perfect for tranquil architectural and interior spaces.

variants.title: Available Sizes and Design Options
variants.text: Majen offers unfilled honed cross cut travertine tiles in a wide range of sizes: 8″x8″, 12″x12″, 12″x24″, 16″x16″, 18″x18″, 24″x24″, 24″x48″, 48″x110″,and Versailles Set. Larger slabs emphasize pattern continuity, while smaller tiles add detail and texture variation. Custom sizes are available for architects and designers requiring unique dimensions.

description: The honed surface provides a refined, elegant matte texture that enhances natural colors while keeping reflections low — ideal for calm, modern environments.
Unfilled pores highlight the stone’s raw character and depth, offering a natural feel that connects indoor spaces with authentic, earthy beauty.
The cross-cut orientation reveals soft, cloud-like patterns instead of straight veins, adding gentle motion and balance to contemporary designs.
Majen follows sustainable quarrying, water recycling, and low-emission finishing practices, ensuring eco-responsible stone production for global projects.

TextSection.text1: Unfilled honed cross cut travertine is ideal for interior floors, wall panels, bathrooms, and luxury lobbies. Its matte texture reduces glare while providing a tactile, grounded feel. The natural pores and cloudy pattern create visual balance and warmth, perfectly suited for modern homes, resorts, and boutique commercial designs that emphasize organic simplicity.
TextSection.text2: The honed surface offers a smooth, non-reflective finish that enhances the natural tones of travertine without gloss. The open pores add authentic texture and breathability, giving each slab a handcrafted appeal. Majen’s advanced calibration ensures even thickness and precise edges, allowing for flawless installation and a refined, contemporary aesthetic.
TextSection.text3: Available in ivory, beige, cream, and light walnut tones, unfilled honed cross cut travertine tiles present warm neutrality and subtle depth. The matte finish enhances the stone’s soft hues, while the cloudy pattern provides natural fluidity. This timeless color palette complements modern minimalist and organic interior concepts beautifully.
TextSection.header4: Maintenance & Durability
TextSection.text4: Unfilled natural travertine is easy to maintain with basic care. Clean using a neutral pH stone cleaner to preserve its tone and texture. Sealing is optional but recommended for high-moisture areas to prevent dust or water absorption. Over time, the stone develops a natural patina, enhancing its authentic, timeless appeal.
TextSection.header5: Why Choose Majen as Your Trusted Travertine Supplier?
TextSection.text5: Majen ensures quality and consistency through direct quarry sourcing, precision finishing, and sustainable production. Each tile is inspected for pattern harmony, tone consistency, and dimensional accuracy. With FOB and CIF delivery, eco-conscious quarrying, and reliable international logistics, Majen provides excellence to clients worldwide.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq_span1: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What defines unfilled honed cross cut travertine tiles?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: They combine open natural pores with a honed matte finish, showcasing cloudy cross-cut patterns for soft, organic elegance.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Where can they be used?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Ideal for floors, walls, and bathroom interiors in both residential and commercial settings that prioritize natural minimalism.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: How is it different from filled travertine?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: Filled travertine has sealed pores for smoothness, while unfilled retains natural cavities for a more authentic texture and organic appearance.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Standard formats range from 8″x8″ to 48″x110″, plus Versailles sets and custom sizes for unique architectural designs.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Sealing is optional but recommended in high-moisture or heavy-use areas to prevent water and dust absorption.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_text: Yes. Majen ships worldwide under FOB and CIF terms with reinforced packaging and complete export documentation.

seo.title: Unfilled Honed Cross Cut Travertine Tiles | Natural Matte Elegance – Majen
seo.description: Majen’s unfilled honed cross cut travertine tiles feature open pores, matte finish, and cloudy texture. Modern, natural, and globally exported for luxury interiors.

unfilled-polished.h1: Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Tiles
unfilled-polished.title: Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Tiles
unfilled-polished.lead: Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Tiles by Majen showcase the harmony between natural authenticity and radiant luxury. Each slab maintains its open pores and natural breathability, while the polished surface adds brilliance and depth. The cloudy cross-cut pattern creates a fluid, elegant texture that enhances interiors with timeless sophistication and warmth.
unfilled-polished.intro: Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Tiles by Majen showcase the harmony between natural authenticity and radiant luxury. Each slab maintains its open pores and natural breathability, while the polished surface adds brilliance and depth. The cloudy cross-cut pattern creates a fluid, elegant texture that enhances interiors with timeless sophistication and warmth.
unfilled-polished.title2: What Are Unfilled Polished Cross Cut Travertine Tiles?
unfilled-polished.intro2: Unfilled polished travertine is created by slicing the stone across its bedding layers to reveal cloudy patterns, then polishing the surface to a high sheen while keeping the pores open. This combination offers a rare contrast — raw texture beneath a reflective surface. The result is a natural stone that radiates elegance and depth, perfect for refined, nature-inspired designs.

variants.title: Available Sizes and Customization
variants.text: Majen offers unfilled polished cross cut travertine tiles in multiple standard sizes: 8″x8″, 12″x12″, 12″x24″, 16″x16″, 18″x18″, 24″x24″, 24″x48″, 48″x110″,and Versailles Set. Large slabs emphasize flowing cloud patterns, while smaller formats offer intricate detail. Custom dimensions and thicknesses are available upon request for architectural precision.

description: The polished finish highlights the stone’s cloudy patterns while maintaining open pores, creating a luminous, naturally textured surface for elegant interior spaces.
Cross-cut travertine reveals soft, organic clouds instead of veins, bringing calmness and natural flow to both traditional and modern design styles.
The unfilled surface allows air circulation, maintaining the stone’s authenticity and stability — ideal for natural, sustainable architectural applications.
Majen’s production process minimizes waste and carbon impact through efficient resource management and responsible quarrying practices.

TextSection.text1: Unfilled polished cross cut travertine tiles are ideal for walls, feature floors, hotel lobbies, residential interiors, and decorative surfaces. Their glossy finish reflects natural light, adding spaciousness and vibrancy. The cloudy pattern and natural pores provide depth and authenticity, making these tiles a premium choice for architects seeking elegance grounded in nature.
TextSection.text2: The polished finish amplifies the stone’s natural colors and highlights the cloudy formations of cross-cut travertine. The open pores preserve the stone’s character and enhance light play, creating a multidimensional surface. Each tile is precisely calibrated for smooth installation, ensuring a luxurious yet natural finish suitable for modern and classic interiors alike.
TextSection.text3: These tiles feature warm tones of ivory, beige, and cream, enriched by the polishing process, which enhances their natural vibrancy. The cross-cut orientation reveals soft, cloud-like movement, giving spaces visual balance and warmth. Each piece reflects unique mineral variations, adding depth, luxury, and individuality to every design.
TextSection.header4: Maintenance & Surface Care
TextSection.text4: Unfilled polished travertine is durable and easy to maintain. Clean with a neutral pH cleaner to preserve its shine and tone. The open pores allow natural air exchange, helping prevent humidity buildup. Occasional sealing enhances protection without diminishing gloss. With proper care, these tiles retain brilliance and strength for decades.
TextSection.header5: Why Choose Majen as Your Global Travertine Supplier?
TextSection.text5: Majen ensures exceptional quality from quarry to export. Each tile is hand-inspected for clarity, color harmony, and polish depth. With FOB and CIF international shipping, reinforced wooden packaging, and sustainable quarrying practices, Majen delivers premium natural stone trusted by global architects and distributors.

QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq_span1: Vein Cut Travertine Tiles
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_header: What defines unfilled polished cross cut travertine tiles?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq1_text: They feature open pores and a polished finish, combining raw natural texture with luxurious sheen and cloudy cross-cut patterns.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_header: Where can these tiles be used?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq2_text: Perfect for interior walls, floors, hotel lobbies, and feature areas where natural luxury and brightness are desired.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_header: Does polishing close the natural pores?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq3_text: No. The surface is polished while keeping pores open, allowing breathability and maintaining natural authenticity.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_header: How do I clean polished travertine?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq4_text: Use a neutral pH stone cleaner and a soft cloth. Avoid acidic or abrasive products to preserve the surface’s natural shine.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_header: What sizes and finishes are available?
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq5_text: Sizes range from 8″x8″ to 48″x110″, plus Versailles sets. Majen also provides honed, brushed, and tumbled finishes upon request.
QuestionsItems.aboutpage_s4_faq6_text: Yes. Majen exports worldwide under FOB and CIF terms, offering reliable delivery, reinforced packaging, and full export documentation.

antiko.title: Wholesale Travertine Special Design Blaundos Antico
antiko.intro: Blaundos Antico travertine is a warm, beige-toned stone with antique character and subtle movement that suits both classic and contemporary designs. Sourced directly from our Uşak–Ulubey region, Majen supplies wholesale slabs with consistent grading, reliable lead times, and reinforced packaging for export. Architects, importers, and contractors choose this variety for durable floors, façades, countertops, and bespoke interior features, achieving timeless elegance with dependable performance across residential and commercial projects.
antiko.alt: Wholesale Blaundos Antiko travertine slabs from Turkey
antiko.title2: Why Choose Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs?
antiko.intro2: Blaundos Antico stands out for its earthy palette, nuanced veining, and antique texture that adds depth without overpowering a space. Its density and calibrated finishes support heavy-traffic areas while remaining easy to maintain. With quarry-direct sourcing, Majen controls selection and grading, ensuring predictable results at scale. Competitive pricing, flexible MOQs, and project-matched lots help streamline specifications. For large orders, we provide sample boards and detailed QC reports, enabling confident decisions for global builds.
description: Why choose Blaundos Antiko slabs: antique-inspired look, expressive veining, bookmatch options and strong continuity on large surfaces. Excellent balance of authenticity and durability for premium interiors.

Sourced and processed in Uşak–Ulubey. Used in island countertops, bathroom vanities, reception desks, wall cladding, elevator surrounds and luxury retail fixtures. Shade-verified lots for consistent project outcomes.

cards.text1: From luxury hospitality to private villas, Blaundos Antico adapts to varied aesthetics. Its neutral warmth pairs well with wood, metal, and glass, allowing cohesive palettes in mixed-material schemes. Designers value its ability to soften minimal interiors or enrich traditional settings with organic texture. Available finishes expand possibilities, from refined polished looks to tactile brushed or tumbled surfaces ideal for outdoor paths and pool surrounds. The result is a reliable, elegant stone that elevates spaces without visual noise.
cards.text2: Calibrated thickness, consistent flatness, and suitable surface treatments help Blaundos Antico perform in lobbies, corridors, and retail zones. Anti-slip options support safety outdoors, while proper sealing enhances stain resistance indoors. With accurate cutting and tight tolerances, installers achieve clean joints and level surfaces, reducing rework and time on site. This blend of aesthetics and practicality positions Blaundos Antico as a proven specification for demanding, design-driven environments across climates and usage patterns.

ApplicationSection.title: Applications of Blaundos Antico Travertine Slabs
ApplicationSection.text: Blaundos Antico is specified for floors, wall cladding, countertops, fireplace surrounds, stair treads, and exterior façades. Its antique texture lends character to boutique hotels and residences, while honed or polished finishes suit refined interiors. Outdoors, brushed or tumbled slabs complement landscaping, garden paths, and pool decks. The stone’s tonal stability supports continuity between inside and outside, helping designers create cohesive transitions. With accurate sizing and reliable supply, it scales from small renovations to flagship builds.
ApplicationSection.subtitle: Interior & Exterior Use Cases
ApplicationSection.subtext: Indoors, Blaundos Antico brings warmth to living areas and statement value to feature walls or reception desks. In kitchens and baths, sealed surfaces provide practical durability with natural beauty. Externally, its weathered look enriches patios and façades, aging gracefully over time. For public spaces, coordinated formats (slabs, tiles, custom pieces) keep design language consistent. Majen’s technical support advises on finish selection, slip ratings, and maintenance to match climate, footfall, and performance requirements.

AvailableSection.title: Available Sizes & Thickness
AvailableSection.text: Majen supplies slabs commonly at 2 cm and 3 cm thickness, cut from blocks selected for tone and structure. Custom dimensions can be produced on request, including book-matched sets for feature walls. Tight calibration and precision polishing ensure flatness and clean edges that speed installation. For special elements—vanities, stair treads, or oversized cladding—our team provides cut-to-size options that maintain vein continuity. Consistent sizing across batches supports predictable waste rates and accurate take-offs.
AvailableSection.subtitle: Dimensional Tolerances
AvailableSection.subtext: Slab thickness is controlled within industry tolerances to support even load distribution and dependable adhesion. Surface regularity reduces lippage risk on large floors, while square edges and stable geometry help installers achieve fine joints in visual-critical areas. For ventilated façades and lightweight assemblies, we coordinate with fabricators to meet bracket and anchor constraints. All dimensions are verified at dispatch, and reports are available for documentation and submittal packages when required.

FinishesSection.title: Finishes & Packaging Options
FinishesSection.text: Blaundos Antico can be supplied polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled to align with design intent and slip resistance needs. Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

TextSection.text1: Explore complementary selections that pair well with Blaundos Antico. Each variety offers distinct tone and movement for different design intents, enabling cohesive palettes across floors, walls, and façades. Discover Blaundos Light Slabs for brighter schemes and Blaundos Ivory Slabs for creamy warmth. Coordinate with Travertine Tiles or Travertine Blocks to extend the language of natural stone through interiors, exteriors, and custom elements while keeping sourcing streamlined under one partner.
TextSection.text2: Ideal for kitchen islands, vanities and lobby walls. Pair with vein-cut bookmatch for dramatic continuity; specify 20–30 mm for interiors, 30+ mm for high-stress zones.
TextSection.text3: Reinforced A-frames, corner and moisture protection, photo-documented loading and shared seal numbers. FOB İzmir or CIF to major ports.

items.a: Its antique texture, warm beige tones, and subtle veining create sophisticated, timeless surfaces suited to both classic and modern designs.
Yes. Brushed or tumbled finishes with proper sealing are recommended for paths, pool decks, and façades.
Polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled. We guide finish choice by location, traffic, and maintenance needs.
Typically 2 cm and 3 cm; custom sizes and book-matched sets are available on request.

items.q: How are slabs packaged for export?
items.a: In reinforced wooden bundles with interleaves, corner guards, strapping, and moisture-resistant wrapping.
Yes. We ship under FOB or CIF terms with full documentation and logistics support.

Finishes are applied with calibrated equipment to keep tone and sheen consistent across lots. For export, slabs are packed in reinforced wooden bundles with corner guards, interleaves, and strapping that limits movement in transit. Moisture-resistant wrapping and clear labeling aid handling at ports and job sites. Packaging is optimized for container loading to minimize risk and freight costs.
FinishesSection.subtitle: Surface Finish Guidance
FinishesSection.subtext: Select polished for premium interiors, honed for low-glare sophistication, brushed where texture is desired, and tumbled for rustic, outdoor-ready charm. In wet areas or exterior paths, combine texture with appropriate sealers to improve maintenance and slip performance. We can supply matched samples across finishes so teams preview appearance under project lighting. This process helps align expectations early, reducing change orders and helping stakeholders approve materials quickly and confidently.
FinishesSection.subtext2: Each bundle is photographed and measured prior to loading. Straps, braces, and internal blocking limit vibration, while protective interlayers reduce abrasion. Bundle IDs map to packing lists for fast checks at customs and on site. Shock indicators can be added on request. The goal is simple: slabs arrive installation-ready, with documentation that keeps receiving and quality verification efficient for importers and contractors.

PartnerSection.title: Why Partner with Majen for Travertine Slabs?
PartnerSection.description: Beyond quarry access, Majen offers technical guidance, flexible MOQs, and dependable lead times that fit real-world schedules. Direct sourcing keeps costs predictable and ensures tone matching across lots. Reinforced packaging, thorough documentation, and responsive support reduce friction during shipping and receiving. We build long-term relationships with importers, distributors, and contractors, providing post-delivery assistance and repeatable quality so projects finish on brief, on budget, and on time.
PartnerSection.text1: From sampling and mock-ups to installation advice, our team responds quickly with practical guidance. Multilingual communication, transparent timelines, and after-sales follow-up help keep stakeholders aligned. Whether you need book-matched features, custom cuts, or coordinated tiles, we manage details and share progress so decisions stay informed.
PartnerSection.text2: We prioritize responsible quarrying, water recycling, and waste reduction. Material traceability and documentation support green building goals and client ESG policies. These practices contribute to durable, long-life installations with lower lifecycle impact.
PartnerSection.text3: We provide packing data, certificates of origin, and HS codes; optional lab tests and slip ratings can be arranged. This documentation simplifies import processes and supports submittals for architects and contractors, helping approvals proceed without delays.

TextSection.text1: Creamier undertone that reads cleaner in minimalist designs.
TextSection.text2: Boutique hospitality, luxury retail, private residences.
TextSection.text3: A-frames, slat protection, seal numbers; FOB/CIF.

BlaundosIntro.title: In the Footsteps of Blaundos
BlaundosIntro.paragraph: We draw inspiration from the time-worn stones of the ancient city of Blaundos. With rich veining and natural tonal shifts, marble (travertine) brings timeless elegance to contemporary design, adding historical depth and lasting beauty to every space.

TravertinePage.title: Wholesale Travertine
TravertinePage.intro: Majen is a leading supplier of travertine export, offering blocks, slabs, tiles, and custom designs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. With decades of expertise, we provide Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory travertine varieties trusted by architects and importers worldwide. Our quarry-direct supply ensures consistent A-grade quality, sustainable production, and competitive FOB/CIF shipping terms. By choosing Majen, you gain a reliable partner for all your travertine projects.
TravertinePage.intro2: Turkey is the world’s largest exporter of travertine, and Majen delivers premium selections to international buyers. Our Wholesale Travertine combines natural beauty, durability, and cost-effectiveness. Sourced from Uşak–Ulubey, our travertine meets international standards with certified quality control. Importers and wholesalers benefit from stable supply, transparent logistics, and flexible shipping options. Majen is the trusted quarry-direct source for clients seeking long-term partnerships in the natural stone industry.

TextSection.text1: Blocks extracted from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry are ideal for factories and wholesalers. Available in Blaundos Antiko, Light, and Ivory, our travertine blocks deliver consistent texture and large sizes for further processing and global shipment. Reinforced packaging ensures safe loading for international container transport.
TextSection.text2: Premium travertine slabs are available in 2, 3, and 5 cm thickness with finishes including polished, honed, brushed, or tumbled. These slabs are designed for both interior and exterior applications, combining strength with natural elegance for architects and builders.
TextSection.text3: Travertine tiles are produced in sizes such as 30×60, 60×60, and 40×80 cm, offering flexibility for different designs. They are ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, patios, and pool areas, combining durability with natural slip-resistant surfaces.
TextSection.header4: Custom Travertine Designs
TextSection.text4: Custom travertine designs include steps, mosaics, borders, and unique architectural cuts tailored for villas, hotels, and signature projects. These bespoke pieces highlight both creativity and the durability of natural stone.
TextSection.subtext1: Average travertine block size is 280×220×200 cm with natural surfaces. Bulk orders are export-ready and suitable for international buyers requiring stability, volume, and reliable supply.
TextSection.subtext2: Countertops, wall cladding, flooring, and façades are among the most popular uses of travertine slabs. Their durability and aesthetic value make them essential for residential, commercial, and hospitality projects worldwide.
TextSection.subtext3: Available in polished, honed, brushed, and tumbled options, travertine tiles can be adapted to both modern and traditional design concepts. These finishes provide variety and performance for diverse architectural needs.
TextSection.subtext4: Custom productions enhance the natural beauty of travertine while delivering exclusive architectural solutions. They elevate living and working spaces with distinctive designs that preserve long-term strength and elegance.

HowWeExportPage.title: How We Export Travertine Worldwide
HowWeExportPage.intro: Majen specializes in travertine export from Turkey, supplying blocks, slabs, tiles, and custom designs directly from our Uşak–Ulubey quarry. With FOB, CIF, and EXW shipping terms, we manage the entire export process — from pro-forma invoice to container loading. Importers rely on Majen’s reinforced packaging, certified quality, and transparent logistics for dependable travertine export from Turkey worldwide.
HowWeExportPage.intro2: Majen offers flexible export methods to match buyer needs. Whether you prefer FOB, CIF, or EXW, Majen provides clear instructions and full documentation for every shipment, ensuring a smooth travertine export process.
HowWeExportPage.intro3: We provide invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin, and inspection reports. All blocks and slabs are reinforced with wooden frames and strapping for safe sea freight.

cards.text1: Majen loads travertine containers at Turkish ports. Buyers arrange international freight. Most common for bulk travertine block orders.
cards.text2: Majen manages shipping, insurance, and freight to buyer’s destination port. Importers prefer this hassle-free option for slabs and tiles.
cards.text3: Buyers arrange pickup directly from our quarry/warehouse. Suitable for importers with their own freight partners.

BlogIndex.title: Travertine Blog
BlogIndex.intro: Guides and insights on travertine sourcing, selection and design.

posts.title: Travertine Guide
posts.excerpt: How to create clean, contemporary spaces using light travertine surfaces.

posts.title: Travertine Tiles
posts.excerpt: Travertine tiles are widely used in flooring and wall coverings, combining natural aesthetics with durability. Available in multiple finishes, they suit modern and traditional designs in residential and commercial spaces.

posts.title: Travertine Slabs
posts.excerpt: Travertine slabs are ideal for large-scale projects requiring seamless surfaces like countertops and facades. Their wide dimensions highlight natural patterns, delivering a luxurious look for interiors and architecture.

posts.title: Travertine Blocks
posts.excerpt: Travertine blocks are the raw form extracted from quarries, then cut and processed into tiles or slabs. Valued by manufacturers and exporters, they are the base material for large projects and custom stonework.

posts.title: Travertine Pavers
posts.excerpt: Travertine pavers are durable outdoor solutions for paths, driveways, patios, and pool decks. Their slip-resistant surface and weather endurance make them a preferred choice for landscaping and exterior projects.

posts.title: Travertine Mosaics
posts.excerpt: Travertine mosaics combine small stone pieces into decorative patterns. Popular in bathrooms, kitchens, and feature walls, they add texture and style while maintaining the durability of natural stone.

posts.title: Polished Travertine
posts.excerpt: Polished travertine offers a glossy, reflective surface ideal for luxury interiors. It enhances the stone’s natural patterns while creating a modern, elegant atmosphere in residential and commercial spaces.

posts.title: Honed Travertine
posts.excerpt: Honed travertine has a smooth, matte surface that provides a softer, more natural look. Perfect for indoor floors, walls, and countertops where a subtle and contemporary appearance is preferred.

posts.title: Tumbled Travertine
posts.excerpt: Tumbled travertine features a weathered, rustic texture that adds character to spaces. Common in outdoor areas, patios, and pool surrounds, it creates a classic Mediterranean or antique style.

posts.title: Brushed Travertine
posts.excerpt: Brushed travertine has a gently textured surface achieved through special treatment. Suitable for both interior and exterior designs, it offers added grip and visual warmth.

posts.title: Filled Travertine
posts.excerpt: Filled travertine has natural pores sealed with resin or cement, creating a smoother surface. Often paired with polished finishes for modern interiors where a clean and refined look is desired.

posts.title: Unfilled Travertine
posts.excerpt: Unfilled travertine retains its natural pores and raw texture. Preferred for traditional or outdoor settings where authenticity and a rugged, natural aesthetic are desired.

posts.title: Ivory Travertine
posts.excerpt: Ivory travertine is bright and elegant, a favorite for luxury interiors. Its light shade creates a spacious, airy feeling, ideal for bathrooms, kitchens, and pool surroundings across contemporary projects.

posts.title: Light Travertine
posts.excerpt: Light travertine offers warm beige tones that blend seamlessly with modern and classic schemes. Versatile for flooring, wall cladding, and outdoor landscaping across residential and commercial spaces.

posts.title: Antico Travertine
posts.excerpt: Antico travertine features rich, earthy hues with an antique effect. Perfect for rustic designs and Mediterranean-style architecture, adding timeless character indoors and outdoors.

posts.title: Travertine Flooring
posts.excerpt: Travertine flooring is prized for durability and natural beauty. With varied finishes and colors, it enhances modern and classic interiors and withstands daily use in homes and commercial spaces.

posts.title: Travertine Cladding
posts.excerpt: Travertine cladding adds elegance to walls and facades, delivering natural insulation and timeless style. A popular choice for residential projects and commercial architecture alike.

posts.title: Travertine Facade
posts.excerpt: Travertine facades create strong, stylish exteriors. Weather resistance and natural variation make them ideal for modern buildings and restoration work seeking authentic stone character.

posts.title: Travertine Bathroom
posts.excerpt: Travertine bathrooms evoke luxury and calm. Used in tiles, mosaics, and vanity tops, the stone brings spa-like warmth and texture to contemporary and classic spaces.

posts.title: Travertine Kitchen
posts.excerpt: In kitchens, travertine works for countertops, backsplashes, and floors. Its natural tones pair beautifully with wood, metal, and minimalist cabinetry for enduring design.

posts.title: Travertine Pool
posts.excerpt: Travertine pool surrounds are slip-resistant, heat-friendly, and refined. They provide a safe, elegant solution for outdoor leisure areas and resort-style landscapes.

posts.title: Travertine Turkey
posts.excerpt: Travertine Turkey is synonymous with quality and scale. Vast reserves and skilled craftsmanship position the country as a top global source for natural stone products.

posts.title: Turkish Travertine
posts.excerpt: Turkish travertine is globally recognized for color diversity and durability. Exported to major markets, it’s a leading material for construction and design projects worldwide.

posts.title: Travertine Quarry
posts.excerpt: Travertine quarries in Turkey produce high-quality blocks at scale. These raw materials are processed into tiles, slabs, and custom products for global distribution.

posts.title: Travertine Supplier
posts.excerpt: A travertine supplier delivers ready-to-use tiles and slabs to buyers worldwide. Reliable partners ensure consistent quality assurance and on-time delivery.

posts.title: Travertine Exporter
posts.excerpt: Travertine exporters connect Turkish stone with international markets, managing logistics, documentation, and quality control throughout the supply chain.

posts.title: Travertine Manufacturer
posts.excerpt: Travertine manufacturers process raw blocks into finished products with advanced machinery. Precision cutting, polishing, and customization meet project demands.

posts.title: Travertine Distributor
posts.excerpt: Travertine distributors supply natural stone to contractors, retailers, and wholesalers, ensuring availability and after-sales support across regions.

Questions.answer1: Turkey offers high-density material and a wide palette of colors such as Ivory, Silver and Noce. Competitive quarry output supports large-scale projects.
Questions.answer2: Common uses include flooring, wall cladding, facades, pool surrounds, bathrooms and gardens.
Questions.q3: What are the differences between filled & unfilled?
Questions.answer3: Filled travertine has pores filled with resin/cement for a smooth finish. Unfilled keeps natural cavities for a rustic texture.
Questions.answer4: Seal periodically, use pH-neutral cleaners, and avoid acidic products. Outdoor pavers may require re-sealing based on climate.
Questions.q5: Is travertine from Turkey suitable for commercial projects?
Questions.answer5: Yes. Thanks to density and color range, Turkish travertine performs in hotels, offices and retail spaces when specified with the right finish and thickness.
Questions.q6: How do I choose between tiles, slabs and pavers?
Questions.answer6: Use tiles for interiors and walls, slabs for seamless surfaces or countertops, and pavers for outdoor traffic areas. Share drawings and we’ll suggest the most efficient mix.

travertine-tiles.metaTitle: Travertine Tiles from Turkey | Sizes, Finishes & Guide
travertine-tiles.metaDesc: Explore Turkish travertine tiles: sizes, finishes, colors, applications, specs and care. Quarry-backed supplier with FOB/CIF export support.
travertine-tiles.intro: Travertine tiles are one of the most popular natural stone products, chosen for their elegance, durability, and timeless appeal. Used across floors, walls, bathrooms, kitchens, and outdoor spaces, Turkish travertine tiles combine centuries of architectural heritage with modern design versatility. Their wide range of colors, finishes, and sizes allow designers, contractors, and homeowners to adapt them to almost any style, from contemporary minimalism to classic Mediterranean charm.

lead.rest: This guide covers colors, finishes, standard sizes, specs and best-use cases so architects, distributors and contractors can specify wholesale travertine tiles with confidence. As a quarry-backed Turkish travertine supplier, we also explain export terms (FOB/CIF/EXW) and packaging so your shipments are predictable and safe.

colors.intro: Color is one of the most important factors when selecting travertine tiles, as it defines the overall atmosphere of a space. Ivory, Light, and Antico travertine tiles are the most sought-after variations, each offering unique tones and patterns. Ivory creates bright, clean environments perfect for luxury interiors. Light offers warm beige tones that blend seamlessly in both modern and traditional designs. Antico, with its rustic hues, is ideal for Mediterranean or antique-inspired spaces. These natural variations ensure no two tiles are identical, adding authenticity and depth to every project.

items.blurb: Ivory travertine tiles offer brightness and sophistication, making them a top choice for residential and commercial interiors.
benefits: Highly durable and resistant to wear in daily use
Enhances natural light by reflecting brightness
Neutral color complements wood, glass, metal and minimalist décor
items.h5: Where to Use Ivory Travertine Tiles
uses: Bathroom floors, walls, and vanity surrounds
Pool decks, spa areas, and wellness centers

items.blurb: Light travertine tiles provide soft beige tones that bring warmth and harmony. Perfect for large flooring areas and open-plan designs, they balance elegance with comfort and are widely used in both residential and commercial spaces.

Antico travertine tiles are valued for their rustic, earthy appearance and antique charm. With natural veining and weathered texture, they evoke Mediterranean heritage and are ideal for courtyards, outdoor kitchens, and projects seeking traditional character.

extras.p: Ivory delivers bright, creamy tones that open up interiors. It’s a favorite for bathrooms, kitchens and light-filled living areas where a clean, modern palette is desired. Batch selection ensures consistent shade across large areas.

Light travertine offers warm beige hues with gentle veining. Designers choose it for large floors and open-plan spaces thanks to its calm, uniform look and easy coordination with wood and metal accents.
Antico brings rustic depth and Mediterranean character. Its earthy variations suit courtyards, outdoor kitchens and feature walls where you want authentic texture and heritage appeal.

finishes.intro: Surface finish transforms how travertine tiles look and perform. Polished tiles emphasize veining and reflect light, creating a luxurious effect in interiors. Honed tiles have a smooth, matte surface that reduces glare and enhances modern designs. Tumbled tiles provide an antique, weathered look, perfect for rustic outdoor spaces. Brushed tiles add gentle texture and slip resistance, making them versatile for both indoor and outdoor use. Selecting the right finish balances style, safety, and practicality, ensuring tiles match the functional and aesthetic goals of any project.

items.blurb: Polished travertine tiles have a glossy surface that highlights natural veining. They are best suited for living rooms, luxury bathrooms, and commercial lobbies where a high-end finish is desired.
Honed travertine tiles provide a soft, matte finish with a modern touch. Their subtle elegance reduces light reflection and makes them comfortable for large interior floors and walls.

Tumbled travertine tiles feature rounded edges and a textured surface, giving an aged, antique effect. They are perfect for patios, walkways, and pool surrounds where a rustic Mediterranean style is desired.

Brushed travertine tiles are treated to create a slightly textured surface. This finish enhances grip and adds visual depth, making them suitable for transitional spaces such as entryways, hallways, and outdoor terraces.

extras.p: Glossy surface that highlights veining—ideal for luxury interiors and feature walls. Use anti-slip treatments where water is present.
Matte, smooth finish with contemporary feel. Recommended for large interior floors and bathrooms thanks to comfortable slip characteristics.
Rounded edges and textured surface for a time-worn look. Perfect for patios, paths and pool decks where grip matters.
Light texture that adds depth and improves underfoot grip. Works well in transitional spaces such as entries, verandas and terraces.

applications.intro: Travertine tiles are prized for their adaptability in both residential and commercial projects. Indoors, they are commonly used for flooring in living rooms and hallways, wall coverings in bathrooms and kitchens, and decorative backsplashes. Outdoors, they withstand weather exposure and serve as durable solutions for patios, pool decks, and landscaped pathways. Their natural texture reduces glare and blends seamlessly with other design materials, such as wood, glass, and metal. This versatility makes travertine tiles a go-to option for architects and homeowners alike.

cards.title: Travertine Flooring
cards.desc: Travertine tile flooring combines durability with elegance. Its natural beauty elevates interiors while resisting daily wear, making it ideal for both homes and commercial projects.

cards.title: Travertine Bathroom
cards.desc: Bathroom applications include walls, floors, and vanity tops. Travertine tiles create spa-like spaces with warmth and luxury while providing moisture resistance.

cards.title: Travertine Kitchen
cards.desc: Travertine tiles enhance kitchens through countertops, backsplashes, and flooring. Their earthy tones complement cabinetry and appliances while ensuring practicality.

details.p: Select thickness (10–12 mm) for interiors and seal after installation. Large formats (e.g., 60×60 or 60×120) speed up installation and minimize grout lines. For commercial lobbies, consider honed/brushed finishes for comfort and safety.
Use honed or tumbled tiles on floors for slip comfort, polished on feature walls or vanity surrounds. Plan a sealing schedule and ventilate spaces to manage humidity.
Backsplashes and floors benefit from honed or brushed finishes; polished is best kept to accent walls. Specify stain-resistant grout and reseal periodically to maintain appearance.

specs.intro: Travertine tiles are manufactured in standard sizes and thicknesses that meet international guidelines for construction and interior design. Indoor tiles typically range from 10–12 mm thick, while outdoor pavers reach 30 mm or more for added strength. Water absorption is usually 0.4–0.8%, highlighting the importance of sealing. Common sizes include 300×300 mm, 400×400 mm, and 600×600 mm, though cut-to-size formats are widely available for custom projects. These properties ensure that travertine tiles perform reliably in both high-traffic interiors and exposed outdoor environments.

table.notes: Seal after install, reapply every 12–24 months
Select finish by location and safety needs

install.intro: Proper installation is key to the performance and longevity of travertine tiles. Installers should apply cement-based adhesive to stable substrates and back-butter large tiles to ensure bonding. Joints should allow for movement, and grouting should be chosen based on flexibility. After curing, sealing is essential to protect tiles from stains and moisture. Routine cleaning with pH-neutral solutions maintains their natural look, while resealing every 1–2 years ensures durability. Avoid acidic cleaners, as they can damage the stone surface.
careNotes: Use cement-based adhesive; back-butter large formats for full contact.
Allow movement joints; choose flexible grout for high-traffic zones.
Seal after curing; maintain with pH-neutral cleaners; avoid acids.
For pool decks, prefer tumbled/brushed; plan periodic re-sealing based on climate.

pros: Classic natural stone look that adds long-term property value
Wide variety of colors, finishes, and sizes for flexible design
Durable and repairable, with long service life when properly maintained
cons: Requires sealing and regular maintenance for stain resistance
Polished finish can become slippery when wet if not treated
Natural variation requires batch selection for uniform appearance

gallery.intro: Explore real-world projects that showcase travertine tiles in action. From luxurious bathrooms and spacious kitchens to outdoor terraces and pool decks, these examples highlight the versatility of travertine across different finishes, colors, and applications.
alts: Ivory travertine tile flooring in modern kitchen
Light travertine bathroom wall tiles with walk-in shower

faq.intro: These frequently asked questions address the most common topics about travertine tiles, including installation, sealing, and suitability for different environments.

items.q: Are travertine tiles good for flooring?
items.a: Yes. Travertine tiles are widely used for flooring because they combine strength, beauty, and durability. They handle daily foot traffic well and maintain a timeless aesthetic. When sealed and cared for properly, they can last for decades in both residential and commercial environments.

items.q: Which finishes are best for bathrooms?
items.a: Honed and tumbled finishes are the most recommended for bathrooms, as they offer slip comfort and a natural feel. Polished finishes may look luxurious but can be slippery when wet, so they are best reserved for vanity tops or decorative walls.

Yes. Like most natural stones, travertine tiles are porous and require sealing to prevent stains and moisture absorption. It is essential to seal upon installation and reapply every 12–24 months, depending on traffic and exposure. This simple maintenance step significantly extends their lifespan.

items.q: Can travertine tiles be used outdoors?
items.a: Absolutely. Travertine tiles, especially in tumbled and brushed finishes, are excellent for outdoor use. They are commonly installed in patios, garden paths, and pool decks due to their slip resistance and weather durability. Proper installation and sealing will maximize performance outdoors.

extra.q: What tile thickness do I need?
extra.a: Indoors, 10–12 mm works for most floors and walls. Outdoors or high-load areas may require 30 mm pavers. We’ll advise based on drawings.

extra.q: Are travertine tiles suitable for pool areas?
extra.a: Yes—tumbled or brushed finishes improve grip for wet zones. Combine with proper drainage and periodic sealing.

extra.q: How is pricing determined?
extra.a: Color grade, finish, size, thickness and order volume affect price. Share a BOQ and destination port for an accurate FOB/CIF quote.

extra.q: How often should I reseal?
extra.a: Typically every 12–24 months depending on exposure and traffic. Kitchens and outdoors may need more frequent care.

microProof: Lead time: typically 10–20 business days by finish and load plan.
FOB İzmir (Alsancak/Aliağa), CIF on request to your destination port.

travertine-slabs.metaTitle: Travertine Slabs | Turkish Ivory, Light & Antico – Finishes, Uses, FAQ
travertine-slabs.metaDesc: Explore Turkish Travertine Slabs in Ivory, Light & Antico. Compare polished, honed, brushed & tumbled finishes for countertops, cladding & facades. Specs, gallery & FAQs.
travertine-slabs.intro: Travertine slabs are large-format natural stone panels widely used in architecture and interior design. Their expansive dimensions highlight natural veining and allow for seamless applications in kitchens, bathrooms, facades, and commercial spaces. Turkish travertine slabs are internationally recognized for their durability, beauty, and versatility, making them the preferred choice for designers and builders worldwide.

lead.strong: Looking for travertine slabs from Turkey?
lead.rest: This guide covers colors, finishes, slab sizes, weight per m² and bookmatching options so architects, distributors and fabricators can plan wholesale travertine slabs with confidence. As a quarry-backed Turkish travertine supplier, we also explain export terms (FOB/CIF/EXW) and packaging standards for predictable deliveries.

colors.intro: Travertine slabs come in timeless colors such as Ivory, Light, and Antico, each offering distinct aesthetics. Ivory provides brightness and sophistication for elegant interiors. Light brings warm beige tones that blend seamlessly into modern and classic environments. Antico delivers earthy, rustic character that evokes Mediterranean and traditional architecture. These natural variations ensure every slab is unique, allowing architects and homeowners to create surfaces that balance functionality with authentic beauty.

items.blurb: Ivory slabs create bright, sophisticated spaces and are a top choice for kitchens and bathrooms.
benefits: Elegant, light-reflecting surfaces enhance room brightness
Durable and suitable for both residential and commercial projects
Neutral tone pairs well with wood, glass, and modern finishes
items.h5: Where to Use Ivory Travertine Slabs
uses: Bathroom vanity tops and shower walls
Interior wall cladding in luxury spaces

items.blurb: Light travertine slabs feature warm beige tones, making them versatile for both interior flooring and exterior cladding projects.
Antico slabs display rustic, earthy colors with an antique effect, often chosen for Mediterranean-inspired architecture and outdoor designs.

extras.p: Bright creamy background with subtle veins. Popular for large interior walls, countertops and feature panels. Provides a modern, clean feel with natural depth.
Warm beige tones with soft patterns. Ideal for continuous flooring and facade cladding where uniformity and warmth are desired.
Rustic appeal with earthy variations. Suits outdoor kitchens, courtyards and spaces that benefit from heritage aesthetics and strong character.

finishes.intro: The finish of a travertine slab defines its texture, reflectivity, and overall character. Polished slabs are glossy and emphasize veining, perfect for luxury interiors. Honed slabs offer a matte finish with contemporary appeal. Brushed slabs introduce a gentle texture and slip resistance, while tumbled slabs create an antique look ideal for rustic projects. Selecting the right finish allows designers to match performance with aesthetics in kitchens, facades, and commercial buildings.

items.blurb: Polished slabs showcase reflective surfaces and bold veining, used in kitchens, bathrooms, and hotel lobbies.
Honed slabs provide a matte, non-reflective finish that fits modern interiors and reduces glare under strong lighting.
Brushed slabs add subtle texture for grip and depth, ideal for transitional areas and outdoor terraces.
Tumbled slabs deliver rustic charm and antique style, widely used in courtyards, gardens, and traditional projects.

extras.p: High-gloss surface that accentuates veining. Recommended for luxury interiors and feature walls. Seal carefully to protect against staining.
Smooth matte finish for contemporary floors and wall panels. Comfortable slip resistance makes it versatile in residential and commercial interiors.
Textured surfaces with more grip. Favored for outdoor facades, terraces and rustic designs. Combine with thicker cuts for durability.

applications.intro: Travertine slabs are used wherever seamless, large surfaces are needed. In kitchens, they become countertops, islands, and backsplashes. In bathrooms, they serve as vanity tops, shower surrounds, and flooring. On building facades, slabs provide strength, weather resistance, and elegance. Commercial interiors such as hotel lobbies and office spaces also benefit from their luxurious appearance. This versatility makes travertine slabs an essential material for both functional and decorative purposes.

cards.title: Kitchen Slabs
cards.desc: Countertops and backsplashes combining durability with natural beauty.

cards.title: Bathroom Slabs
cards.desc: Vanities and shower walls creating spa-like environments.

cards.title: Facade Slabs
cards.desc: Exterior facades offering strength, insulation, and aesthetic value.

details.p: Slabs for countertops, islands and backsplashes. Use honed for daily durability, polished for statement islands. Seal regularly to prevent staining from oils and wine.
Large wall panels create seamless spa-like surfaces. Honed slabs reduce glare, polished accents add luxury. Ensure waterproofing and correct anchoring.
Slabs applied as ventilated facade panels or anchored cladding. Thickness often 20–30 mm depending on wind load and building codes. Consider bookmatching for visual impact.

specs.intro: Travertine slabs are processed in large dimensions to meet international design and construction requirements. Standard slabs range from 2400–3000 mm in length and 1200–2000 mm in width. Thickness typically falls between 20–30 mm, with custom cuts available from 15–40 mm. Water absorption is around 0.4–0.8%, making sealing essential. These specifications make travertine slabs suitable for demanding applications, from residential kitchens to high-traffic commercial facades.

table.notes: Seal after installation and maintain regularly
Select finish by functional and design needs

install.intro: Installing travertine slabs requires professional handling due to their size and weight. Proper support and adhesive must be used to ensure stability. In kitchens and bathrooms, sealing is critical to protect against staining and moisture. Outdoor facades should include appropriate anchoring systems. Routine care involves cleaning with neutral products and resealing every 12–24 months. Avoid acids and harsh chemicals that may damage the stone surface.
careNotes: Use mechanical anchors or ventilated facade systems for exteriors.
Back-butter slabs with adhesive indoors for full bond.
Seal periodically with high-quality impregnating sealer.
For bookmatched slabs, dry-lay before installation to align veins.

pros: Large slabs create seamless, luxurious surfaces
Highlight natural veining and patterns for striking designs
Durable, long-lasting, and add property value
cons: Heavier and more difficult to handle than tiles
Higher cost compared to smaller tile formats
Requires sealing and professional installation
